commodatum: <entryFree id="n9413" type="main" key="commo^da_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 2. commodo.</entryFree>
commodatus: <entryFree id="n9414" type="main" key="commo^da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. commodo.</entryFree>
commode: <entryFree id="n9415" type="main" key="commo^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. <itype>commodus</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> B. 3.</entryFree>
commoderatus: <entryFree id="n9416" type="main" key="commo^de^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mŏdĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n9416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brought into the right measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exact</hi>: dispositio, Cod. Th. 14, 17, 15.</sense></entryFree>
commodianus: <entryFree id="n9417" type="main" key="Commo^di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Commŏdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Commodus, II.</entryFree>
commoditas: <entryFree id="n9418" type="main" key="commo^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>commodus</etym>. <sense id="n9418.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Due measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just proportion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">symmetry</hi> (so very rare): commoditas et aequitas membrorum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9418.1" n="B" level="2"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">fitness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a suitable oratorical expression</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">corresp. to commode dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9418.2" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to commodus, II.) <hi rend="ital">Easy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unrestrained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free action</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis aliqua commoditas non naturā data, sed studio et industriā parta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dexterity</tr>, <tr>skill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:25:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 25, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9418.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Convenience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id, ob commoditatem itineris ponte sublicio... conjungi urbi placuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9418.4" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">fitness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convenience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fit occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benefit</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">commoditatis omnes articulos scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in loco opportunitas, in occasione commoditas ad faciendum idonea (consideranda est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:12:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 12, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">o Fors Fortuna, quantis commoditatibus hunc onerastis diem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimas et maximas commoditates amicitia continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 36, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 12, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">percipere fructum aut commoditatem ex re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum commoditas juvaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 60, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9418.5" n="2" level="3"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">pleasantness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complaisance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forbearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lenity</hi> (only ante-class. and in Ov.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir lepidissime, Cumulate commoditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 76</bibl>: patris, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 310</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9418.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> in Plaut.: <cit><quote lang="la">commoditas mea, as a term of endearment,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commodius: <entryFree id="n9419" type="main" key="Commo^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Commŏdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Commodus, II.</entryFree>
commodo: <entryFree id="n9420" type="main" key="commo^do^1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdŏ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>commodus</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> B. 2.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9421" type="main" key="commo^do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. commodus</etym>. <sense id="n9421.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To adjust according to a measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to adapt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accommodate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put in order</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">trapetum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9421.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoda loquelam tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita praeceptorem eloquentiae ... se commodaturum singulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te commodaveris mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:34:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(arithmetica) avaritiae commodat digitos,</quote> <trans><tr>fits</tr>, <tr>adapts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 88, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(servi) nulli sceleri manus commodabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:20:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 3, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam suam Prisco ad turpissimum ministerium commodasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationi oculos, vocem, manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:71:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 71, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecus claudo pede commodat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 133</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9421.2" n="II" level="1"> Commodare <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi> (<hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to give something to one for his convenience</hi> or <hi rend="ital">use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lend</hi> (acc. to accurate jurid. distinction, of things that are themselves, in natura, to be returned, while mutuum dare is used of things for which an equivalent is given; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:7:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 7, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. and class.): aquam hosti, operam civi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:21 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 21 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam meritus de me est, quod queam illi ut commodem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus tu quaecumque commodaris, erunt mihi gratissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 48 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid sine detrimento possit commodari, id tribuatur vel ignoto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut dando et accipiendo mutuandisque facultatibus et commodandis nullā re egeremus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit> B. and K.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 275, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes falsos,</quote> <trans><tr>to furnish</tr>, <tr>supply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum morituro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:70" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum Caelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 13, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13,30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes ad nuptias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 51, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen suum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:42:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 42, § 91</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires suas aliis eas commodando, minuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem alienae dominationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 32</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: parvis peccatis veniam, magnis severitatem,<cb n="COMM" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19</bibl>: aurem patientem culturae, as in Engl., <hi rend="ital">to lend an ear to</hi>, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:75" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 75</bibl> (opp. donare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut haec a virtute donata, cetera a fortunā commodata esse videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:6:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 6, 19 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9421.3" n="B" level="2"> Of time for a payment, <hi rend="ital">to grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut rei publicae, ex quā crevissent, tempus commodarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:48:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 48, 10</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n9421.4" n="C" level="2"> Commodare <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquā re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in aliquā re</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to please one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be kind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obliging to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to serve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnibus rebus, quod sine molestiā tuā facere possis, ei commodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 35, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 53, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui omnibus in rebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 32, 2</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">commodare tantum ei in hac re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 37</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tuam ob causam cuiquam commodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eo libentius iis commodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 54</bibl></cit>: credetur; <cit><quote lang="la">commodabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publice commodasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:9:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 9, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illis benignis usus est ad commodandum, id. ib, 2, 4, 3, § 6: studiis commodandi favetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 207</bibl></cit>: cui ego quibus cumque rebus potero lubentissime commodabo, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 275, 17</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdā-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; in the jurists, </sense><sense id="n9421.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A thing lent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a loan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodatum accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:3:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 6, 3, § 3</bibl></cit>; cf. the whole title 6.—</sense><sense id="n9421.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A contract for a loan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 6, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:17:section=3" default="NO">13, 6, 17, § 3</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commodulatio: <entryFree id="n9422" type="main" key="commo^du^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mŏdŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n9422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">regularity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proportion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">symmetry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commodule: <entryFree id="n9423" type="main" key="commo^du^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdŭlē</orth>, <sense id="n9423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. dim.</hi> [commode, v. <itype>commodus</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>], <hi rend="ital">at one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s convenience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveniently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suilably;</hi> only Plaut., ludere, Rud. 2, 5, 11, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commodulum: <entryFree id="n9424" type="hapax" key="commo^du^lum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>commodum</etym>, <sense id="n9424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small advantage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9425" type="main" key="commo^du^lum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdŭlum</orth>, <sense id="n9425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. dim.</hi> [commodum, v. <itype>commodus</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> 1. a.], <hi rend="ital">according to convenience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 155</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 8</bibl> Fleck. (al. commodule).</sense></entryFree>
commodum: <entryFree id="n9426" type="main" key="commo^dum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 1. commodus, III. A.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n9427" type="main" key="commo^dum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. <itype>commodus</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> 1.</entryFree>
commodus: <entryFree id="n9428" type="main" key="commo^dus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mŏdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n9428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has a due</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proper measure;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n9428.1" n="I" level="1"> Object., <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of full weight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">due</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Plaut.): statura,</quote> <trans><tr>a tall stature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viginti argenti minae,</quote> <trans><tr>full twenty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 134</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 144</bibl>: minae bonae); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talentum argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 266, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novem cyathis commodis miscentur pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:16:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 1, 16, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis valetudo commodior,</quote> <trans><tr>more firm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 77</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf. to the person: vivere filium atque etiam commodiorem esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be better</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9428.2" n="II" level="1"> Subject., <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convenient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commodious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi> for some one or something, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendly to</hi> (in every period and species of composition); constr. with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> (v. the foll.). </sense><sense id="n9428.3" n="A" level="2"> Of things. </sense><sense id="n9428.4" n="1" level="3"> With <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n9428.5" n="a" level="4"> Of the purpose or use: <cit><quote lang="la">curationi omnia commodiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec pecori opportuna seges nec commoda Baccho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9428.6" n="b" level="4"> Of the person: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc et vobis et meae commodum famae arbitror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod erit mihi bonum et commodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla lex satis commoda omnibus est (corresp. with prodesse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primordia eloquentiae mortalibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc sibi commodissimam belli rationem judicavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sit stella homini commoda, quaeque mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 27, 4.—</sense><sense id="n9428.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:67:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 67, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius ceterum commodius iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commodissimus in Britanniam transjectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodius anni tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciliore ac commodiore judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae satis commodae de Britannicis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:7:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 7, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodissimum esse statuit, omnes naves subduci, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9428.8" n="3" level="3"> With or without <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi> in the phrase commodum est, <hi rend="ital">it pleases</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is agreeable</hi>, = libet: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde ut commodum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 2</bibl>: <cb n="COMM" /> dum erit commodum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id non commodum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:13:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 13, § 33</bibl> Ascon.; 2, 2, 16, § 39; 2, 1, 26, § 65; 2, 3, 70, § 165; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:49:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 49, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:23:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 23, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:48:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 48, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id si tibi erit commodum, cures velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 48, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9428.9" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <case>acc.</case> of purpose (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nec satis ad cursus commoda vestis Erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:288" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 288</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9428.10" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> in <hi rend="ital">u</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc exornationis genus ... commodum est auditu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 18, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9428.11" n="B" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">serving a neighbor</hi> or (more freq.) <hi rend="ital">accommodating one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to his wishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neighborly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentle</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi commodus uni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 227</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemquamne existimas Catone commodiorem, communiorem, moderatiorem fuisse ad omnem rationem humanitatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 31, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodior mitiorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:13:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 13, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apronius, qui aliis inhumanus ac barbarus, isti uni commodus ac disertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:9:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 9, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commodus comissator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">commodus meis sodalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier commoda, Faceta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 2, 3</bibl>.—In a double sense with I. supra: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tu commoda's, capillum commodum esse credito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 98</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the measure of iambic verse: <cit><quote lang="la">spondeos in jura paterna recepit Commodus et patiens,</quote> <trans><tr>sharing the paternal rights with them</tr>, <tr>in a fraternal manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 257</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9428.12" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n9428.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A convenient opportunity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convenience</hi> (rare, but in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">nostrum exspectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tamdiu sedens meum commodum exspectet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 38, 1: velim aliquando, cum erit tuum commodum, Lentulum puerum visas,</quote> <trans><tr>when it shall be convenient for you</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 28, 3</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n9428.14" n="b" level="4"> In the connection commodo meo, tuo, etc., per commodum, ex commodo, <hi rend="ital">at</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">according to my</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thy</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">convenience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveniently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s leisure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi spatium ad dicendum nostro commodo vacuosque dies habuissemus,</quote> <trans><tr>according to our convenience</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:18:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 18, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod commodo tuo fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 48, 1</bibl>: suo commodo me convenire, Caes. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ib. 14, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi consul copias per commodum exponere posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam lecturus ex commodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 46:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 46, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 19, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. festinanter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9428.15" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Advantage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit</hi> (very freq. in all periods and species of composition): <cit><quote lang="la">commodum est, quod plus usus habet quam molestiae: bonum sincerum debet esse et ab omni parte innoxium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:36 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 36 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut malis gaudeant atque ex incommodis Alterius sua ut comparent commoda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex illius commodo meum compararem commodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:9:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 9, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui tam subito tot congruerint commoda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(honestatem) ipsam suo splendore ad se animos ducere, nullo prorsus commodo extrinsecus posito, Cic. Ac. Fragm. ap. Aug. contr. Ac. 3, 7, 15 (IV. 2, p. 470 Orell.): sequi matris commodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:82:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 82, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra valetudinis commodum laborare,</quote> <trans><tr>to the injury of health</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 23, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in publica peccem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">populi commoda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9428.16" n="b" level="4"> Specif., <hi rend="ital">a reward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wages for public service</hi>: veteranorum, Brut. et Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus provincialibus ornamentis commodisque depositis,</quote> <trans><tr>emoluments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 14, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">emeritae militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 49</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militibus commoda dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:131 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 131 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9428.17" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privilege</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immunity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9428.18" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A useful thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a good</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoda vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:36:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 36, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera opinione bona sunt... proprietas in illis boni non est. Itaque commoda vocentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter commoda illas (divitias) numeratis: atqui eādem ratione ne commodum quidem erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 87:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 87, 29</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9428.19" n="e" level="4"> Sometimes commodo or per commodum, adverb. antith. to that which is <pb n="382" /> <cb n="COMM" />injurious, <hi rend="ital">without injury</hi> or <hi rend="ital">detriment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut regem reducas, quod commodo rei publicae facere possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si per commodum reipublicae posset, Romam venisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9428.20" n="3" level="3"> Concr., = commodatum, <hi rend="ital">that which is lent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a loan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui forum et basilicas commodis hospitum, non furtis nocentium ornarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 5, 25, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9428.21" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi>: </sense><sense id="n9428.22" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv. temp.</hi> (only in colloquial lang. and post-class. prose writers). </sense><sense id="n9428.23" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">At a fit time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just in time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the very nick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the very moment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seasonably</hi> ( = opportune, <foreign lang="greek">eu)kai/rws</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">ecce autem commodum aperitur foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodum adveni domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orditur loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse exit Lesbonicus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">eu)kai/rws</foreign> ad me venit, cum haberem Dolabellam, Torquatus... commodum egeram diligentissime, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:47" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 47</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9428.24" n="b" level="4"> To designate a point of time that corresponds with another, or that just precedes it, <hi rend="ital">just</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just now.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9428.25" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad te hercle ibam commodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurus, sectatoribus commodum dimissis, sedebat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si istac ibis, commodum obviam venies patri,</quote> <trans><tr>just meet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 107</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9428.26" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">postquam</hi> or (more freq.) with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> in a parallel clause: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam me misisti ad portum cum luci simul, Commodum radiosus ecce sol superabat ex mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom huc respicio ad virginem, Illa sese interea commodum huc advorterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodum discesseras heri, cum Trebatius venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emerseram commodum ex Antiati in Appiam, cum in me incurrit Curio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit> B. and K. (al. commode); so with the <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> and a foll. <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 19, 1</bibl>; 13, 30, 2; 10, 16, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adducitur a Veneriis Lollius commodum cum Apronius e palaestrā redisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 61</bibl></cit> B. and K. (Zumpt, commode): <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam filiae nostrae dies natalis appeteret, commodum aderant, quae muneri miseratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:50" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 50</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9428.27" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdŏ</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv. temp.</hi>, = commodum, a., <hi rend="ital">just in time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seasonably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just at this time</hi> (ante-class. and very rare): commodo eccum exit, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 177</bibl> P. (i. e. in tempore, Charis.): commodo de parte superiore descendebat, Sisenn. ib.: commodo dictitemus, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 174</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> p. 177.—</sense><sense id="n9428.28" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> </sense><sense id="n9428.29" n="a" level="4"> (Acc. to commodus, I.) <hi rend="ital">Duly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">properly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neatly</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">suo quique loco viden' capillus satis compositu'st commode?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 97</bibl></cit>: commode amictus non sum, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltare, Nep. praef. § 1: legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 9:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 34, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa breviter et commode dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 33 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. prol. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:58:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 58, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feceris commode mihique gratum, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commode facere, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodius fecissent tribuni plebis, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—In medic.: <cit><quote lang="la">commode facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to do well</tr>, <tr>be beneficial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9428.30" n="b" level="4"> (Acc. to commodus, II.) </sense><sense id="n9428.31" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Conveniently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aptly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis commode quam strenue navigavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille satis scite et commode tempus ad te cepit adeundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos istic commodissime sperem esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explorat, quo commodissime itinere valles transiri possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ego commodius quam tu vivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 110</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consumere vitiatum commodius quam integrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui commodissime subjungitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 82</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9428.32" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In a friendly manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acceptae bene et commode eximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9428.33" n="c" level="4"> (Equiv. to <itype>commodum</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> b.) <hi rend="ital">Just</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just at the moment when</hi>, etc.; only v.l. in the doubtful passages cited supra, commodum, b. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9429" type="main" key="Commo^dus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Commŏdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen;</hi> so L. Aelius Aurelius Commodus, <hi rend="ital">Roman emperor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 15 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9429.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Commŏdĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Commodus</hi>:<cb n="COMM" />  horti, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">thermae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Nigid. 6 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n9429.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Commŏ-dĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">Nonae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9429.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Commŏ-dus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: mensis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">August</hi>, which Commodus wished to name after himself, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commoenio: <entryFree id="n9430" type="main" key="commoeni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commoenĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. communio.</entryFree>
commolenda: <entryFree id="n9431" type="gloss" key="Commo^lenda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Commŏlenda</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Conm-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>commolo</etym>, <sense id="n9431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess who presided over the felling of trees struck by lightning</hi>, Fratr. Arv. ap. Orell. Inscr. 1, p. 390; cf.: Adolenda, Coinquenda, and Deferunda.</sense></entryFree>
commolior: <entryFree id="n9432" type="main" key="commo_li^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mōlĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>ītus, 4</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (ante- and post-class. and very rare); prop., <sense id="n9432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set in motion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoliri tempestas fulmina coeptat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 255</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamenta virum commoliri atque ciere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 242</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: dolum aut machinam, Caecil. Stat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 73</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: nimis moleste confabricatus commolitusque est originem vocabuli, <hi rend="ital">has undertaken</hi>, Favorin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:19:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 19, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commolitus: <entryFree id="n9433" type="main" key="commo_li_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commōlītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. commolior.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n9434" type="main" key="commo^li^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏlĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from commolo.</entryFree>
commollio: <entryFree id="n9435" type="hapax" key="commolli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mollĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to soften</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duritias palpebrarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
commolo: <entryFree id="n9436" type="main" key="commo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mŏlo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grind thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pound</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">(grana) minutissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivam, bacam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 50, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. also Commolenda.</sense></entryFree>
commonefacio: <entryFree id="n9437" type="main" key="commo^ne^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏnĕ-făcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>fēci, factum</itype> (<sense id="n9437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> -fio, -factus sum, -fieri), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>commoneo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to remind one forcibly</hi> (of something), <hi rend="ital">to put in mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to admonish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to impress upon</hi> (in good prose, most freq. in Cic.); constr. with <case>acc.</case> (personae or rei), <hi rend="ital">a rel.clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te propter magnitudinem provinciae etiam atque etiam esse commonefaciendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:72:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 72, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">humorously: commonefacere aliquem monimentis bubulis,</quote> <trans><tr>to give one a remembrance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">aliquem alicujus rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipse te veteris amicitiae commonefaceret, Auct,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 24, 35</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quemque beneficii sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 4</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:43:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 43, § 112</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">aliquem de aliquā re</hi>, Cod. Th. 1, 1, 3: simul commonefacit, quae ipso praesente in concilio Gallorum de Dumnorige sint dicta, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so with a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, Metell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 3, 2</bibl>: simul commonefecit, sanxisse Augustum, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi eum commonefaciunt, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 41</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius turpem praeturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:64:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 64, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores vetustatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commoneo: <entryFree id="n9438" type="main" key="commo^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mŏnĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remind one forcibly of something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put in mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to impress upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring to recollection</hi> (in good prose); constr. (cf. admoneo). </sense><sense id="n9438.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut commoneri nos satis sit, nihil attineat doceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:130" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 130</bibl>: commonito pro rostris populo, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 22</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (notarum) recordatio commoneat et quasi excitet memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9438.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">aliquem alicujus rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mearum me absens miseriarum conmones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammaticos officii sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ejus matrimonii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 33, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hic modo me commonuit anulus quod totum effluxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9438.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">aliquem de aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de avaritiā tuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:59:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 59, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:27:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 27, 96</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9438.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">aliquem aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium vostrum ut vos malo cupiatis conmonerier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—Simply with <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum amice aliquid commonemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae commonet usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:111" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 111</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>)With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam hic mihi sit facile atque utile, Aliorum exempla commonent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">commonere aliquem cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc qui venerit mi in mentem, re conmonitus sum modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 47</bibl></cit> Fleck. (Brix.: hoc qui in mentem venerit mi? Re ipsā conmonitus sum).—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque me consuetudo, neque amor commoneat, ut servem fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ut ordini rerum animum intendat, etiam commonendus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoneo tamen, ne quis hoc cottidianum habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">alicujus rei</hi>: horum<cb n="COMM" />  tamen utcumque commonet locus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commonitio: <entryFree id="n9439" type="main" key="commo^ni^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏnĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>commoneo</etym>, <sense id="n9439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an earnest reminding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">putting in mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an admonition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:9" default="NO">4, 4, 9</bibl>; Cod. Th. 6, 35, 10 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 14:54" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 14, 54</bibl> dub.).</sense></entryFree>
commonitor: <entryFree id="n9440" type="hapax" key="commo^ni^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏnĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who earnestly reminds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 7:105" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 7, 105</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
commonitorius: <entryFree id="n9441" type="main" key="commo^ni^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏnĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>commonitor</etym>, <sense id="n9441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suitable for reminding</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9441.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏ-nĭtōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a writing for reminding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a letter of instructions</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 5:21" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 5, 21</bibl>; Cod. Th. 2, 29, 2, § 3; 6, 29, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 129" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 129 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9441.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a means of reminding</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commonitus: <entryFree id="n9442" type="main" key="commo^ni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏnĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from commoneo.</entryFree>
commonstro: <entryFree id="n9443" type="main" key="commonstro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-monstro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (old form conmonstrasso = commonstravero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 5</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">point out something fully</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi> (perh. only in Plaut., Terence, and Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">si istunc hominem, quem quaeritas, Tibi conmonstrasso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes meos mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem commonstrarier Mihi istum volo, aut ubi habitet demonstrarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:41:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 41, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 46, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes argumentorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges fatales ac necessarias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 12 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conmonstrabo, quo facile inveniatis loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commoratio: <entryFree id="n9444" type="main" key="commo^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>commoror</etym>. <sense id="n9444.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dwelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tarrying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lingering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sojourning</hi> (so only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">villa et amoenitas illa commorationis est, non deversorii,</quote> <trans><tr>is suitable for a place of residence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:7:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 7, § 23</bibl></cit> (and perh. urbana, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 3</bibl>). —</sense><sense id="n9444.1" n="B" level="2"> In rhet. lang., <hi rend="ital">a delaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwelling upon some important point</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 45, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:4" default="NO">9, 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9444.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an abiding place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwelling</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3</bibl> Esd. 1, 21; 9, 37.</sense></entryFree>
commordeo: <entryFree id="n9445" type="main" key="commorde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mordĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bite sharply</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi> (in post-Aug. prose, and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tela ipsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:29:section=2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 29, § 2</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of abusive lang., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 21:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 21, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commorior: <entryFree id="n9446" type="main" key="commo^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mŏrĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>mortuus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n9446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at the same time with one</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; not in Cic.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, with the <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9446.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in acie cum Arunte commortuus est (Brutus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:8:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 8, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9446.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obviam ire et commori hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 89</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">hostibus suis morte suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18:17" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18, 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 77:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 77, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 14, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9446.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 11, 11, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 21, 24, § 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 19, 10</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Commŏrĭentes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a comedy of Piautus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now lost</hi>, composed in imitation of the <foreign lang="greek">*sunapoqnh/skontes</foreign> of Diphilus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 7</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 725</bibl> P. (acc. to Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 9</bibl>, not genuine).—</sense><sense id="n9446.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo venena commoriuntur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>their effects vanish together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commoris: <entryFree id="n9447" type="main" key="Commoris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Commoris</orth>, is <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n9447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortress in Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Mount Amanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commoro: <entryFree id="n9448" type="gloss" key="commo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. commoror.</entryFree>
commoror: <entryFree id="n9449" type="main" key="commo^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mŏror</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n9449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">act.</hi> access. form ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P.). </sense><sense id="n9449.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9449.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to stop</hi> somewhere, <hi rend="ital">to tarry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">linger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sojourn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Cic. (about thirty times) and in Quint.): Romae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ephesi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brundisii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Helorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:36:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 36, § 95</bibl></cit> (ad Cybistra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 6</bibl>; B. and K. moratus): circum istaec loca, Pompon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, C, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Alyziam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tam miserā vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Milo paulisper, dum se uxor comparat, commoratus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commorandi natura devorsorium nobis, non habitandi locum dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesivit... an tardare ac commorari te melius esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ad Brut. 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper consistere et commorari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">commorantes menses trahere,</quote> <trans><tr>bring in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 71, § 147</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9449.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (mostly with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> only once <pb n="383" /> <cb n="COMM" /> with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">consilium diutius in armis civilibus commorandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum singulis paene syllabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">31: in componendā togā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:156" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 156</bibl></cit>.—Of discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">ut haereat in eādem commoreturque sententiā,</quote> <trans><tr>to dwell upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 40, 137</bibl></cit> (quoted by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 41</bibl>); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:de Or. 2:72:292" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 292</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse supervacaneum fuerit hic commorari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa mihi veritas manum injecit et paulisper consistere et commorari cogit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9449.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retard one</hi> (ante- and post-class.).— <cit><quote lang="la">Prop.: an te auspicium conmoratum est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me nunc conmoror, has foris quom non ferio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantharum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:14:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 14, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 3, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commorsito: <entryFree id="n9450" type="main" key="commorsi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-morsĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-sico</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bite to pieces</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 195, 14</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 249</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commortalis: <entryFree id="n9451" type="hapax" key="commorta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mortālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n9451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mortal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:20:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 20, 4</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
commosis: <entryFree id="n9452" type="greek" key="commo_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/mmwsis</foreign>, <sense id="n9452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gummy substance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the groundwork in honey-making</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 7, 6, § 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commotiae: <entryFree id="n9453" type="gloss" key="commotiae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commotiae</orth> <itype>Lymphae, ad lacum Cutiliensem a commotu, quod ibi insula in aquā commovetur</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=71" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 71</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
