commotio: <entryFree id="n9454" type="main" key="commo_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commōtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>commoveo</etym>, <sense id="n9454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a moving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">motion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9454.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vasorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:13" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:9" default="NO">2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:43:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 43, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9454.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rousing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exciting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commotion</hi> (cf. commoveo, II. B.) (class.): commotionem accipi volunt temporarium animi motum, sicut iram, pavorem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commotio suavis jucunditatis in corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:28:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 28, 61</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and without animi, of the emotions or passions: temperantia moderatrix omnium commotionum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 14, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 15, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 10, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commotiuncula: <entryFree id="n9455" type="hapax" key="commo_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commōtĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>commotio</etym>, <sense id="n9455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight excitation of disease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indisposition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
commoto: <entryFree id="n9456" type="hapax" key="commo_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commōto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>commoveo</etym>, <sense id="n9456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to move very violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to agitate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidue,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commotor: <entryFree id="n9457" type="main" key="commo_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commōtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who sets in motion</hi> (late Lat.): Liber et Libera seminum commotores et emissores, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 3.</sense></entryFree>
commotus: <entryFree id="n9458" type="main" key="commo_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from commoveo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9459" type="main" key="commo_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commōtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>commoveo</etym>, <sense id="n9459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a moving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=71" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 71</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:95" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 95</bibl>; v. commotiae.</sense></entryFree>
commoveo: <entryFree id="n9460" type="main" key="commo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mŏvĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>mōvi, mōtum, 2</itype> (contr. forms: <sense id="n9460.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">commōrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 766</bibl></cit>; commōrat, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 278, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 51</bibl>; commōrit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 45</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">commossem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 37, 90</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">commosset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 45</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">commosse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 37</bibl></cit>, § 96; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 3</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to put something in violent motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to move;</hi> both of removing from a place and backwards and forwards in a place; <hi rend="ital">to shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stir</hi> (freq. in every period and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n9460.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9460.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To remove from a place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">displace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to start</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set in motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque miser me commovere possum prae formidine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 181</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilius est currentem incitare quam commovere languentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:55:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 55, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra ex eo loco,</quote> <trans><tr>to move forward</tr>, <tr>decamp</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 37</bibl></cit>, § 96; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <trans><tr>to set the line in motion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:65:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 65, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 27, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex eo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me Thessalonicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te istinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: agmen loco. <hi rend="ital">to force back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to retreat</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 58, 20</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 29, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to use in business</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 11</bibl></cit> (1, 1); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 19, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ais, si una littera commota sit, fore tota ut labet disciplina. Utrum igitur tibi litteram videor an totas paginas commovere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:19:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 19, 53</bibl></cit>.—Sacra, t. t., <hi rend="ital">to move</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry about the sacred utensils</hi>, <hi rend="ital">images</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">for religious use</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 301</bibl> Serv.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 134, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancilia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tripodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 786" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 786</bibl></cit>.—Hence, humorously: mea si commovi sacra, <hi rend="ital">if I put my instruments</hi> (artifices, <cb n="COMM" /> tricks, etc.) <hi rend="ital">in motion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 107</bibl>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebam commosset in agro decumano Siciliae nemo,</quote> <trans><tr>would have stirred a clod</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9460.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To set in motion in a place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to move hither and thither</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9460.4" n="1" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">magni commorunt aequora venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 766</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 217</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">penna commota volucris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:59" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 633" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 633</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9460.5" n="2" level="3"> Of persons, with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis sese commovere potest, cujus ille (sc. Roscius) vitia non videat?</quote> <trans><tr>can stir</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:57:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 57, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num infitiari potes te... meā diligentiā circumclusum commovere te contra rem publicam non potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Lanuvii hastam se commovisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 62, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9460.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9460.7" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I. A.) <hi rend="ital">To move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distodge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc comminus agamus experiamurque, si possimus cornua commovere disputationis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si convellere adoriamur ea, quae commoveri non possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 205</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9460.8" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B.) <hi rend="ital">To throw into disorder</hi>, physical or mental; <hi rend="ital">to unbalance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsettle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">adflantur alii sidere, alii commoventur statis temporibus alvo, nervis, capite, mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 41, 41, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perleviter commotus fuerat ... (postea) eum vidi plane integrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: Bacchi sacris commota, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commotus habebitur, i. e. mente captus,</quote> <trans><tr>frantic</tr>, <tr>crazed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 209</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commota mens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 278</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 21, 40, § 152</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">commotus mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9460.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To move in mind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feeling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make an impression upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affect</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n9460.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: commorat hominem lacrimis, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 278, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem nimiā longinquitate locorum ac desiderio suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut libidine aliquā aut metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 16, 36</bibl> (12, 26): <cit><quote lang="la">ludis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:19:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 19, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim, cum sibi fingit aliquid et cogitatione depingit, non simul ac se ipse commovit atque ad se revocavit, sentit, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>aroused</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et amore fraterno et existimatione vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctā voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus atrocitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix sum apud me, ita animus commotu'st metu, Spe, gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commota vehementi metu mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 153</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9460.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">commorat omnes nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliqua species utilitatis objecta est, commoveri necesse est,</quote> <trans><tr>one must be affected by it</tr>, <tr>it must make an impression on one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil me clamor iste commovet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quos adversum proelium et fuga Gallorum commoveret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commovendis judiciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 189</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commotus ab oratore judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me commorit, flebit,</quote> <trans><tr>provoke</tr>, <tr>rouse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neptunus graviter commotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domo ejus omnia abstulit quae paulo magis animum cujuspiam aut oculos possent commovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34:section=83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34, § 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 50</bibl>: dormiunt; <cit><quote lang="la">pol ego istos commovebo,</quote> <trans><tr>awake</tr>, <tr>arouse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus haec ipsa et palaestra Graecarum disputationum memoriam quodammodo commovent,</quote> <trans><tr>stir up</tr>, <tr>awaken</tr>, <tr>revive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 5, 20</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum,</quote> <trans><tr>to demand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commotā principis domo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 52</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si umquam vitae cupiditas in me fuisset, ego... omnium parricidarum tela commossem?</quote> <trans><tr>provoked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 37, 90</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9460.12" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum ingeniis conflictatur ejus modi, Neque commovetur animus in eā re tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi enim vos in hoc nomine, cum testis diceret, commoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:56:section=125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 56, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac virgine commotus sum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9460.13" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam cum esset ex aere alieno commota civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:33:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 33, 58</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Afr. 57, 72.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sane satis commoveor animo ad ea. quae vis canenda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines ad turpe compendium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 40, 52</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeone me ignavom putas, ut neque me consuetudo neque amor Commoveat neque commoneat, ut servem fidem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua nos voluntas commovit, ut conscriberemus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9460.14" n="b" level="4"> Of the passions, etc., <hi rend="ital">to rouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generate</hi>: belli magnos <cb n="COMM" /> commovit funditus aestus, <hi rend="ital">moved the waves of strife from their foundations</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1434</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commovere tumultum aut bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:8:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 8, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiam, invidiam, iracundiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 195</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commovere miserationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:64" default="NO">10, 1, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum et acerbum dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam aliquam in me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum odium in eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:54:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 54, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum scribendi studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 6; 5, 8, 3; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectus vehementer commotos (opp. lenes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9460.15" n="C" level="2"> In discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">nova quaedam,</quote> <trans><tr>to start new doctrines</tr>, <tr>adduce novelties</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">commōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">moved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aroused</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus (dicendi) in agendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 9, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Fimbria paulo fervidior atque commotior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 34, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidere in rem commotam (i. e. amorem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 116:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 116, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus commotior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:37:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 37, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commotius ad omnia turbanda consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14, 9</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Drusus animo commotior,</quote> <trans><tr>more violent</tr>, <tr>passionate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commotus ingenio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 45</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippina paulo commotior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoto similis,</quote> <trans><tr>to one provoked</tr>, <tr>enraged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 51</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> apparently not in use.</sense></entryFree>
commugento: <entryFree id="n9461" type="gloss" key="commugento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commugento</orth>, <itype>for convocanto</itype>, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=65:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 65, 17</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
commulceo: <entryFree id="n9462" type="main" key="commulce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mulcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (very rare, and mostly post-class.), <sense id="n9462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to caress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coax</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">soothe much.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9462.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum trepidantem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 229, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9462.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to soothe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cajole</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">narium sensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, p. 35</bibl></cit>: sensus judicum honorificis sententiis, Tiro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commulco: <entryFree id="n9463" type="hapax" key="commulco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mulco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beat violently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
communalis: <entryFree id="n9464" type="main" key="commu_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>commune</etym>, <sense id="n9464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to the community</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aggen.</author> p. 41</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
commundo: <entryFree id="n9465" type="main" key="commundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mundo</orth>, no <sense id="n9465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to cleanse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purify wholly</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vasa eluere et commundare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier ornata, sed non commundata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 25, § 10</bibl></cit>; Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Obseq.</author> 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commune: <entryFree id="n9466" type="main" key="commu_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūne</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. communis.</entryFree>
communicarius: <entryFree id="n9467" type="gloss" key="commu_ni^ca_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūnĭcārius</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dies</orth>), <itype>in quo omnibus dīs communiter sacrificabatur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220:19" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220, 19</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
communicatio: <entryFree id="n9468" type="main" key="commu_ni^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūnĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>communico</etym> (several times in Cic., elsewh. rare), <sense id="n9468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imparting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">communicating.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9468.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">largitio et communicatio civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam societas et communicatio utilitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: criminis cum pluribus, Tiro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the like appellation of several objects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 14, 80, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:1:section=14" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 27, 3, 1, § 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9468.2" n="II" level="1"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">a figure of speech</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nakoi/nwsis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">in accordance with which one turns to his hearers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as it were</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allows them to take part in the inquiry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 204</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:20" default="NO">9, 2, 20</bibl> and 23.</sense></entryFree>
communicator: <entryFree id="n9469" type="main" key="commu_ni^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūnĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (postclass.). <sense id="n9469.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He who makes one a participant in a thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei familiaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 154 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n9469.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He who has part in a thing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
communicatus: <entryFree id="n9470" type="main" key="commu_ni^ca_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūnĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from communico.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9471" type="main" key="commu_ni^ca_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūnĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>communico</etym>, <sense id="n9471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a participation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 44, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
communiceps: <entryFree id="n9472" type="gloss" key="commu_ni^ceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mūnĭceps</orth>, <itype>cĭpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born in the same municipal town</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3062</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
communico: <entryFree id="n9473" type="main" key="commu_ni^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūnĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n9473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> access. form, communicati sint = communicaverint, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 24, 2</bibl>) [communis]. </sense><sense id="n9473.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To divide something with one</hi>, whether in giving or receiving. </sense><sense id="n9473.2" n="A" level="2"> In giving, <hi rend="ital">to divide a thing with one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to communicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to share;</hi> esp. freq. of imparting in discourse (very freq. in all periods); constr. usu. <hi rend="ital">aliquid cum aliquo;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">inter aliquos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquem aliquā re. cum aliquo de aliquā re</hi> and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9473.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">aliquid cum aliquo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si quam praestantiam virtutis, ingenii, fortunae consecuti sunt, impertiant ea suis communicentque cum proximis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:47:section=125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 47, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 11, 33</bibl>: auxilium<pb n="384" /> <cb n="COMM" />  sibi te putat adjunxisse, qui cum altero rem communicat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam causam cum Chrysogono,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 48, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum iis praemium communicat, hortaturque ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem nostram vobiscum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam civium cum servis fugitivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 56, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at sua Tydides mecum communicat acta (i. e. me socium sumit actorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia cum finitimis civitatibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to make common cause</tr>, <tr>to take common counsel</tr>, <tr>commune</tr>, <tr>consult</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plebeiis magistratibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 11, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 28, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam doloris cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.—Of discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">homo, quocum omnia, quae me curā aliquā adficiunt, una communicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae didicerant, cum civibus suis communicare non poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 20 al.</bibl>; so <hi rend="ital">cum aliquo de aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius, qui mecum... de te communicare solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is mecum de tuā mansione communicat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum compluribus de ratione belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 18</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9473.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid inter aliquos</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de societate inter se multa communicarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socii putandi sunt, quos inter res communicata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:20:section=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 20, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quibus de rebus vellemus, tu tuis, ego meis, inter nos communicaremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 27, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">communicato inter se consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 25, 9</bibl></cit> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9473.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui aliquid</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">de aliquā re</hi> (in Cic. only when the other party sharing is expressed by <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Krebs, Antibarb. p. 250): quibus communicare de maximis rebus Pompeius consuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 18</bibl></cit> (Dinter, ex conj., quibuscum): <cit><quote lang="la">hisque omnium domus patent victusque communicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with redditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi communicatum cum alio, non ademptum imperium esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 27, 8</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">id aut ereptum illis est, aut certe nobis cum illis communicatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:254" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 73, 254</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4, 14</bibl> Halm ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 142</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Pan. Max. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:39:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 39, 94</bibl> Ascon.—* </sense><sense id="n9473.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">communicabo semper te mensā meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: nonne prius communicatum oportuit? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et secundas res splendidiores facit amicitia et adversas partiens communicansque leviores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 6, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad se veniat rationesque belli gerendi communicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia communicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 75 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 30, 36, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9473.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> of things: aliquid cum aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to join to an equal part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to unite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri, quantas pecunias ab uxoribus dotis nomine acceperunt, tantas ex suis bonis cum dotibus communicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privabo potius illum debito testimonio, quam id cum meā laude communicem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9473.8" n="3" level="3"> In late Lat.: cum aliquo or alicui, <hi rend="ital">to have intercourse with an inferior</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cum peregrinis communicarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malis,</quote> <trans><tr>with evil-disposed persons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 162" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne communices homini indocto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—Also alicui rei, <hi rend="ital">to take part in</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 5, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9473.9" n="B" level="2"> In receiving, <hi rend="ital">to share something with one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">receive a part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to partake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participate in</hi> (also class.). </sense><sense id="n9473.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid cum aliquo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me juves Conmunicesque hanc mecum meam provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 153</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam cum Antonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitias mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sibi cum illo rationem communicatam putat,</quote> <trans><tr>believes that he has all things in common with him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 142</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 48, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 2</bibl>. § 5 Zumpt; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 27, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud dubitavit (Thalestris) fateri ad communicandos cum rege liberos se venisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 30</bibl></cit> Vogel ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n9473.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo labores et discrimina, mox et gloriam communicabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9473.12" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">altari Christi,</quote> <trans><tr>to receive the sacrament</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 162" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 162</bibl></cit>; id. contra Cresc. 3, 36.—</sense><sense id="n9473.13" n="II" level="1"> In Tertull., acc. to communis, II., <hi rend="ital">to make common</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to contaminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Patient. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
communicor: <entryFree id="n9474" type="main" key="commu_ni^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūnĭcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. communico <sense id="n9474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
communio: <entryFree id="n9475" type="main" key="commu_ni^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mūnĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fortify on all sides</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to secure</hi>, <cb n="COMM" /> <hi rend="ital">barricade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrench</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n9475.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">castella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 32, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:58:1" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 58, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca castellis idonea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 49, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">os arteriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:11:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 11, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9475.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make sure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strengthen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem aulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 6</bibl></cit> (cf. aula, II. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">causam testimoniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:26:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 26, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9476" type="main" key="commu_ni^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūnĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>communis</etym>, <sense id="n9476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a communion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutual participation</hi> (several times in Cicero, elsewhere rare). </sense><sense id="n9476.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter quos est communio legis, inter eos communio juris est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum et vocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: sermonis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:36:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 36, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficiorum, praemiorum civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures partes communione complecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pristinā communione manere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagariam communionem inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9476.2" n="II" level="1"> In eccl. Lat. </sense><sense id="n9476.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Church communion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Hist. Sacr. 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Ps. 57" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Ps. 57</bibl>, n. 15.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9476.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sacrament of the Lord</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s supper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">communion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sancti altaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 54:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 54, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
communis: <entryFree id="n9477" type="main" key="commu_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mūnis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">comoinis</orth>, S. C. de Bacch.), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>con and root mu-, to bind; Sanscr. mav-; cf.: immunis, munus, moenia</etym>, <sense id="n9477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is common to several</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">universal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public</hi> (opp. proprius, that belongs to one: <cit><quote lang="la">quod commune cum alio est, desinet esse proprium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:28" default="NO">7, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:6" default="NO">8, 5, 6</bibl>; 10, 1, 16; 12, 10, 42; 12, 3, 7; v. also the foll.; freq. in all periods and every species of composition); constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9477.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus verbum hoc quidem est: Communia esse amicorum inter se omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinea vulpibus et hominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum Asiae Europaeque Troja,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is fit ei cum Roscio communis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum nobis cum dis, alterum cum beluis commune est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 1, 4</bibl>.—Esp. freq. in the formula aliquid cum aliquo commune habere: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustas habet aliquid commune cum multis, amor non habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rerum naturā... quid habere potest commune... gallinaceum fel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversia. quae communes minime cum aliis quaestiones habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:110" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum... nihil vobiscum commune habentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 15:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sciat, se nihil mecum habere commune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:12:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 7, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia cum amico communia habebit, qui multa cum homine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 48:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 48, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:74:17" default="NO">74, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:37:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 2, 37, 2</bibl>: nec habet (pecudum natura) quidquam commune cum caelo, Lact. de Ira Dei, 7, 4; 8, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:1:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 1, 25</bibl>, B: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium commune omnium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 11, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 260</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:326" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 326</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:555" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 555</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">communis imperii (i. e. Romani) fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <trans><tr>natural</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>prose</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epig. 81, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: vitae ignarus, <hi rend="ital">ignorant of life</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the customs of society</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sensu caret,</quote> <trans><tr>of a sense of propriety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 66</bibl></cit> Heind.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sit in beneficio sensus communis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:105:3" default="NO">105, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 20</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: communium litterarum et politioris humanitatis expers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communis locus, euphem.,</quote> <trans><tr>the lower world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 19</bibl></cit>; and for <hi rend="ital">a brothel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2, p. 83" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2, p. 83</bibl> Bip.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <trans><tr>public places</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:46:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 46, § 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 11, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but loci, in philos. lang.,</quote> <trans><tr>a commonplace</tr>, <tr>common topic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:27:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 27, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:11" default="NO">2, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:1:3" default="NO">5, 1, 3</bibl>; 5, 12, 15; v. locus.—</sense><sense id="n9477.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">commūne</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is common.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9477.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut communibus pro communibus utatur, privatis ut suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis ostendi gemis et communia laudas,</quote> <trans><tr>publicity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 271</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">de communi aliquid consequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 18, § 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus communi dividundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 42</bibl>; Dig. <cb n="COMM" /> 2, 1, 11, § 2 al.—</sense><sense id="n9477.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp. = <foreign lang="greek">to\ koino/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a community</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>: commune Latium, Cinc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=241:18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 241, 18</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Commune Milyadum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:38:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 38, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siciliae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>, § 114; 2, 2, 59, § 145; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 2, 63, § 154: gentis Pelasgae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">communis Graecia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:199" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 199</bibl></cit>; and: res communis = respublica, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 522, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9477.5" n="b" level="4"> In commune. </sense><sense id="n9477.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">For common use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for a common object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantage</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">metuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocare honores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to bestow equally upon patricians and plebeians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profutura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborare (apes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 24</bibl></cit>.—Rarely in communi: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9477.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generally</hi> (in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">de jure omni disputandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">40 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9477.8" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Halves!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 119:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 119, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9477.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9477.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That represents the common sentiment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">democratic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in bello... suo et certorum hominum consilio uteretur, eum magis communem censemus in victoriā futurum fuisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9477.11" n="B" level="2"> Of manners, <hi rend="ital">accessible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">familiar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condescending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affable</hi> (kindr. in sense with comis; hence in MSS. very freq. interchanged with it; <cit><quote lang="la">v. comis): simplicem et communem et consentientem eligi (amicum) par est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">communis infimis, par principibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 5</bibl>; cf. communitas.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl> dub. (al. comior).—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 22</bibl> dub. (al. comissimus).— </sense><sense id="n9477.12" n="C" level="2"> T. t. </sense><sense id="n9477.13" n="1" level="3"> In rhet.: <cit><quote lang="la">commune exordium, quod nihilo minus in hanc quam in contrariam partem causae potest convenire,</quote> <trans><tr>equally appropriate to either side of a cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:18:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 18, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 319</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9477.14" n="2" level="3"> In gram.: verbum, <hi rend="ital">a common verb</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one that has both an active and passive signification</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:13:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 787</bibl> P.: syllaba = anceps, i. e. <hi rend="ital">either long</hi> or <hi rend="ital">short</hi>, Don. p. 1389 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 3</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 423</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <trans><tr>of both masculine and feminine gender</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 126</bibl></cit> ib. et saep.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9477.15" n="1" level="3"> Class. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">commū-nĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jointly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generally</hi> (very freq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 20, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:37:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 37, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 262</bibl>.—Opp. proprie, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. separatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 12, 32</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 480</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n9477.16" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">commūnĭtus</orth>: deos colere, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 510, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
communitas: <entryFree id="n9478" type="main" key="commu_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>communis</etym>. <sense id="n9478.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Community</hi>, <hi rend="ital">society</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fellowship</hi> (very freq. in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere rare): nulla cum deo homini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:41:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 41, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicionis, aequitatis, legationis cum hoc gladiatore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et conjunctio humana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 44, 157</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae atque victūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 14, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9478.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sense of fellowship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">community in feeling</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnis honestas manet a partibus quattuor, quarum una sit cognitionis, altera communitatis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:152" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 43, 152</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 153</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 45, 159</bibl>; 3, 5, 24; 3, 33, 118.— </sense><sense id="n9478.2" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to communis, II.) <hi rend="ital">Courtesy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condescension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affability</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 8, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
communiter: <entryFree id="n9479" type="main" key="commu_ni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūnĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>communis</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, 1.</entryFree>
communitio: <entryFree id="n9480" type="main" key="commu_ni_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūnītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. communio</etym>. <sense id="n9480.0" n="I" level="1"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">the making</hi> or <hi rend="ital">preparing of a way;</hi> trop. = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o(dopoi/hsis</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">anne autem principium aut rei totius, quae agetur, significationem habere debebit, aut aditum ad causam et communitionem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 320</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9480.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a fortification</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
communitus: <entryFree id="n9481" type="main" key="commu_ni^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūnĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>communis</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, 2.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n9482" type="main" key="commu_ni_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. communio.</entryFree>
commurmuratio: <entryFree id="n9483" type="hapax" key="commurmu^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commurmŭrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>commurmuro</etym>, <sense id="n9483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a general murmuring</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commurmuro: <entryFree id="n9484" type="main" key="commurmu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-murmŭro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">com-murmŭror</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n9484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to murmur to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with others</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n9484.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">clauso commurmurat ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:821" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 821</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ciconiae) congregatae inter se commurmurant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 31, § 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9484.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Dep.</hi> form: ut scriba secum ipse commurmuratus<pb n="385" /> <cb n="COMO" />  sit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 61</bibl>: commurmurantur <foreign lang="greek">au)toi/</foreign>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 178, 9</bibl> (Sat. Men. 64, 8).</sense></entryFree>
commutabilis: <entryFree id="n9485" type="main" key="commu_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>commuto</etym>, <sense id="n9485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subject to change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changeable</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n9485.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec imbecilla et commutabilis pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commutabilis, varius, multiplex animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 26, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principia verbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9</bibl></cit>. § 99 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n9485.2" n="II" level="1"> In rhet.: <cit><quote lang="la">exordium quod ab adversario potest, leviter mutatum, ex contrariā parte dici, = commune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:18:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 18, 26</bibl></cit>; so * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commutate: <entryFree id="n9486" type="main" key="commu_ta_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūtātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a changed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">altered manner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 42, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commutatio: <entryFree id="n9487" type="main" key="commu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a changing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alteration</hi> (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n9487.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">annuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 34, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestatum atque caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 42, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrae aestuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnae rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:94" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum aut studiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9487.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n9487.3" n="A" level="2"> In rhet. </sense><sense id="n9487.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A figure of speech; a reciprocal opposition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">change</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ntimetabolh/</foreign> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 85</bibl>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 28, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9487.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A change</hi> in words, pronunciation, or method of treatment, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct.
