Her.</author> 4, 42, 54 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9487.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An exchange.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9487.7" n="1" level="3"> Captivorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 19</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n9487.8" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to commuto, II. B.) Of words, <hi rend="ital">a conversation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conference</hi>, Claud. Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:26" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commutatus: <entryFree id="n9488" type="hapax" key="commu_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commūtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (for the class. commutatio), <sense id="n9488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alteration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commutatum venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:795" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 795</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commuto: <entryFree id="n9489" type="main" key="commu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mūto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n9489.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To alter wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change entirely</hi> (class.; most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n9489.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia migrant, Omnia commutat natura et vortere cogit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:829" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 829</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:594" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 594</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:589" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 589</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 936: signa rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:25:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 25, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem et vultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 11:42" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 11, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae commutantur fiuntque contraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>.—Of fruits, <hi rend="ital">to decay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:69:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 69, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9489.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp. rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to change one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s form of expression</hi>: commutabimus tripliciter, verbis, pronuntiando, tractando, i. e. <hi rend="ital">vary our style</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 42, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9489.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad commutandos animos atque omni ratione flectendos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 52, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil commutantur animo et idem abeunt qui venerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9489.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To exchange something with another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interchange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">replace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substitute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traffic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9489.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., constr. with <case>acc.</case> alone, or with <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, or <case>abl.</case> alone, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9489.6" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conmuto ilico pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi aetate hoc caput colorem conmutavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 13, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se conmutant vestem ac nomina,</quote> <trans><tr>interchange</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta templorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9489.7" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n9489.8" n="(a)" level="5"> Of person: <cit><quote lang="la">(loricam) secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9489.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Of thing: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam constantiae cum caritate patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 16, 37</bibl></cit>: mortem cum vitā, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9489.10" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">(litteras) D pro A,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum pro oleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n9489.11" n="4" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi oculos orationemque aliam conmutas tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem suam et religionem pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 46, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornandi causā proprium (verbum) proprio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:42:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 42, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessionis invidiam pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leve compendium fraude maximā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 19, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: hanc esse rem, quae si sit semel judicata, neque alio commutari... possit, <hi rend="ital">replaced</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">made good</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:53:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 53, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victum vitamque priorem novis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium belli gerendi agriculturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustum aere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:26:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9489.12" n="5" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make an exchange</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vin conmutemus? Tuam ego ducam et tu meam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid de se diceretur, non dubitaret interpellare et commutare,</quote> <trans><tr>to change the subject</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9489.13" n="B" level="2"> Esp. of speech, <hi rend="ital">to exchange words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to discourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">converse</hi> (so only twice in Ter.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">commutatio, II.): unum verbum tecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tria Verba inter vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
como: <entryFree id="n9490" type="main" key="co_mo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmo</orth>, <itype>mpsi</itype> (msi), mptum (mtum), 3, <cb n="COMO" /> <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>co- (i. e. con) and emo; cf.: demo, promo</etym>. <sense id="n9490.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bring together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construct</hi> (Lucretian): <cit><quote lang="la">dum perspicis omnem Naturam rerum quā constet compta figurā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:950" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 950</bibl></cit> Munro ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ea quo pacto inter sese mixta quibusque compta modis vigeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus e rebus cum corpore compta vigeret (animi natura), Quove modo distracta rediret in ordia prima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9490.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To care for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take care of.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9490.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop., in the class. per. usu. of the care of the hair, <hi rend="ital">to comb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">braid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dress; absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amica dum comit dumque se exornat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 832</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitidum caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput in gradus atque anulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comas acu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comas hasta recurva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:560" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos dente secto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:83" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 83</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the person: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdos Fronde super galeam et felici comptus olivā,</quote> <trans><tr>wreathed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 751</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tisiphone serpentibus undique compta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri praecincti et compti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longas compta puella comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9490.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to adorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora si quis vulsa atque fucata muliebriter comat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">19: colla genasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:110" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes et cingula manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 525</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9490.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> of things: <cit><quote lang="la">vittā comptos praetendere ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 128</bibl></cit>: colus compta, i. e. <hi rend="ital">furnished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adorned with wool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 194</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9490.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cleopatra simulatum compta dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 83</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq. of rhet. ornament: <cit><quote lang="la">non quia comi expolirique non debeat (oratio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae orationisque comendae gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">comptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-mtus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">adorned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornamented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes ut femina compti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima mundissima atque comptissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quant. Anim. 33" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quant. Anim. 33</bibl></cit>.—But usu. of discourse, <hi rend="ital">embellished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compta et mitis oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 9, 28</bibl></cit> (al. composita): <cit><quote lang="la">comptior sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Vinicius) comptae facundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the person: <cit><quote lang="la">Isocrates in diverso genere dicendi nitidus et comptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 79</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">comptē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">comt-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">with ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegantly</hi>, only trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">compte disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 75:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 75, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:52" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 52</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comptius dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:53" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 53</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 66</bibl>, acc. to Ritschl (al. comissime).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9491" type="main" key="co^mo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmo</orth>, no <sense id="n9491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [coma]. </sense><sense id="n9491.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be furnished with hair</hi> (as <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> only post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 28, 246</bibl>.—But freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n9491.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Having long hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hairy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covered with hair</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">colla equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">equus florā et comante jubā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:59" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saetae hircorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 312</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis comata villis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:122" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galea = cristata,</quote> <trans><tr>crested</tr>, <tr>plumed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 391</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cristae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 468</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9491.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of growths, etc., resembling hair: <cit><quote lang="la">stella,</quote> <trans><tr>having a radiant</tr>, <tr>hairy train</tr>, <tr>a comet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 749</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astro comantes Tyndaridae,</quote> <trans><tr>ornamented with stars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:267" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sera comans narcissus,</quote> <trans><tr>that puts out leaves late</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictamnus flore Purpureo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum silvae,</quote> <trans><tr>leafy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:403" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:429" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <trans><tr>luxuriant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 8, 16, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:550" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 550</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:502" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 502</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9491.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clothe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deck with hair</hi> or <hi rend="ital">something like hair</hi> (as <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> only post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl>.—Freq. (esp. in the post-Aug. per.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">having long hair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:83:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 83, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:636" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 636</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmā-tus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:73:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 73, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:70:9" default="NO">12, 70, 9</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">adj. propr.</hi>: Gallia Comata, <hi rend="ital">Transalpine Gaul</hi> (opp. togata), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 443</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <trans><tr>leafy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comoedia: <entryFree id="n9492" type="greek" key="co_moedi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmoedĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n9492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> comoediai, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 51</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">kwmw(di/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a comedy</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=99" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 99</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=39:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 39, 6</bibl> ib.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:65" default="NO">10, 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:281 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 281 al.</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. prol. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. prol. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: spectare, Ter. And. prol, 27: exigere, <hi rend="ital">to hiss from the stage</hi>, id. <cb n="COMP" /> ib.; cf. id. Hec. alt. prol. 4 and 7.—</sense><sense id="n9492.1" n="II" level="1"> The younger Pliny humorously named a villa, which was on low ground, comoedia, in opp. to one on high ground, qs. lifted up on a buskin, which he called tragoedia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comoedice: <entryFree id="n9493" type="main" key="co_moedi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmoedĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. comoedicus.</entryFree>
comoedicus: <entryFree id="n9494" type="greek" key="co_moedi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmoedĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kwmw(diko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n9494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to comedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3</bibl></cit>, n. 16, p. 353, 27.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cō-moedĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">as in comedy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">astitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=61:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 61, 11</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
comoedus: <entryFree id="n9495" type="greek" key="co_moedus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmoedus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kwmw(do/s</foreign>, <sense id="n9495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to comedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natio,</quote> <trans><tr>adapted to comedy</tr>, <tr>given to acting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:100" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 100</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n9495.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmoedus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a comedian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comic actor</hi> (while histrio is a play-actor in gen.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:1" default="NO">1, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:91" default="NO">11, 3, 91</bibl>; 11, 3, 181; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:94" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:73" default="NO">6, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 47</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:22:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 22, § 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comosus: <entryFree id="n9496" type="main" key="co^mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coma</etym>, <sense id="n9496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hairy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with much</hi> or <hi rend="ital">long hair</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 37</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">leafy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus tithymali comosissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 45, § 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 6, 8, § 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compaciscor: <entryFree id="n9497" type="main" key="compa^ciscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-păciscor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-pĕcis-cor</orth>, <itype>pactus or pectus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n9497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make an agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form a compact with one</hi> (only in <hi rend="ital">temp. perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">partic.</hi>, and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si sumus compecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 129</bibl></cit>: mecum matrimonio compecta sit, id. Cist. Fragm. Mai, p. 17, v. 11.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9497.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">compactum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">compectum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an agreement</hi>, only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compacto (compecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 5, 8</bibl></cit> B. and K.), <hi rend="ital">according to agreement</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in accordance with a previous compact</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 177</bibl> P.; Cic. Scaur. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 12, 2</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conpecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 11, 7</bibl></cit>.—In a similar sense: <cit><quote lang="la">de conpecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 126</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ex compacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 53, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compaco: <entryFree id="n9498" type="main" key="compa_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pāco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring to peace</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compacticius: <entryFree id="n9499" type="main" key="compacti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compactĭcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = compactus, <sense id="n9499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">agreed upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">soter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compactilis: <entryFree id="n9500" type="main" key="compacti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compactĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>compactus, compingo</etym>. <sense id="n9500.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pressed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joined together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compact</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes,</quote> <trans><tr>fitted one to another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operimentum (of nuts),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9500.1" n="II" level="1"> Of form, <hi rend="ital">thick-set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compact;</hi> of lions, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 18, § 46</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of bees,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compactio: <entryFree id="n9501" type="main" key="compacti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>compingo</etym>. <sense id="n9501.0" n="I" level="1"> In abstr., <hi rend="ital">a joining together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n9501.1" n="II" level="1"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">the things that are joined together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a structure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frame</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15, 2</bibl> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
compactivus: <entryFree id="n9502" type="main" key="compacti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compactīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suitable for joining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gummi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compactum: <entryFree id="n9503" type="main" key="compactum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compactum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. compaciscor, II.</entryFree>
compactura: <entryFree id="n9504" type="hapax" key="compactu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compactūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>compingo</etym>, <sense id="n9504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining together;</hi> only concr., <hi rend="ital">a joint</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compactus: <entryFree id="n9505" type="main" key="compactus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. compingo.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n9506" type="main" key="compactus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. compaciscor.</entryFree>
compaedagogita: <entryFree id="n9507" type="gloss" key="compaeda^go_gi_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compaedăgōgīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">sumpaidagwgi/ths</foreign>), <sense id="n9507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">educated in the same pœdagogium;</hi> of slaves, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2818 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
compaedagogius: <entryFree id="n9508" type="gloss" key="compaeda^go_gi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compaedăgōgĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = compaedagogita, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 361, 97</bibl>.</entryFree>
compaganus: <entryFree id="n9509" type="gloss" key="compa_ga_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compāgānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of the same village</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 209, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compages: <entryFree id="n9510" type="main" key="compa_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compāges</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">compāgo</orth>, ĭnis; <case>nom.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:43" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 43</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> compaginem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 91:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 91, 12</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> compagine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 711</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 717</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 725</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 838</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root pag-; v. pango</etym>, <sense id="n9510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a connection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">structure</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n9510.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1070" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1070</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 487</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:491" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 491</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:12" default="NO">4, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 3, 6, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi> compagum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 2, 2, § 5</bibl> Sillig.— </sense><sense id="n9510.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Veneris compagibus haerent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the embraces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1201" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1201</bibl>: dum sumus in his inclusi compagibus corporis, <hi rend="ital">bodily structures</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 21, 77</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:127:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 127, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 119</bibl>.—So of the body of the state, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 74 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> <pb n="386" /> <cb n="COMP" /></sense></entryFree>
compagina: <entryFree id="n9511" type="main" key="compa_gi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compāgĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>compago</etym>, <sense id="n9511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combination</hi> (peculiar to the agrimensores): litterarum, Baro ap. Goes. <bibl default="NO"><author>Agrim.</author> p. 239</bibl>, and Innoc. ib. pp. 245 and 246.</sense></entryFree>
compaginatio: <entryFree id="n9512" type="main" key="compa_gi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compāgĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n9512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joint</hi>, = compages, junctura. <foreign lang="greek">a(rmogh/</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.; Ambros. in. Psa. 37, § 29; Cassiod. in. Psa. 17, 6.</sense></entryFree>
compagino: <entryFree id="n9513" type="main" key="compa_gi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compāgĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>compago</etym>. <sense id="n9513.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To join together</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28, 2, 3</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 889; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 13:30 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 13, 30 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9513.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to border upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compaginantes agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Agrim.</author> p. 346</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
compago: <entryFree id="n9514" type="main" key="compa_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, v. compages.</entryFree>
compagus: <entryFree id="n9515" type="gloss" key="compa_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pāgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one belonging to the nearest village</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3793</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compalpo: <entryFree id="n9516" type="hapax" key="compalpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-palpo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stroke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Temp. 214" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. Temp. 214</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compar: <entryFree id="n9517" type="main" key="compar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-par</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>păris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<case>abl.</case> compari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 44, 7</bibl>: <sense id="n9517.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">compare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 5, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 359</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> comparum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 64</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">like</hi> or <hi rend="ital">equal to another</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; after the Aug. per. also in prose). </sense><sense id="n9517.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n9517.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: natura viri compar uxori, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1251</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:42:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 42, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites militibus, centurionibus centuriones, tribuni tribunis compares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9517.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl></cit> (7), 11, 1.—</sense><sense id="n9517.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulatio Latinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compari Marte concurrerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 44, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9517.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst. comm.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an equal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a companion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comrade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colleague</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 3, 9</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9517.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n9517.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">One beloved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a spouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 2, 18</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 5, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2656</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the queen in chess,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 359</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n9517.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A figure of speech whereby several members of a period have an equal number of syllables</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 20</bibl>. 27.</sense></entryFree>
comparabilis: <entryFree id="n9518" type="main" key="compa^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compărābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. comparo</etym>, <sense id="n9518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be compared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comparable</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30, 47</bibl> and 49: <cit><quote lang="la">mors trium virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:52:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 52, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comparate: <entryFree id="n9519" type="main" key="compa^ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compărātē</orth> <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. comparo <sense id="n9519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
comparaticius: <entryFree id="n9520" type="main" key="compa^ra_ti^ci^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compărātĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. comparo</etym>, <sense id="n9520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comparable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9521" type="main" key="compa^ra_ti^ci^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compărātĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. comparo</etym>, <sense id="n9521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished by contribution</hi>: aurum, Cod. Th. 7, 6, 3.</sense></entryFree>
comparatio: <entryFree id="n9522" type="main" key="compa^ra_ti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compărātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. comparo</etym>, <sense id="n9522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comparison</hi> (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n9522.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: comparationis duo sunt modi; <cit><quote lang="la">unus cum idemne sit an aliquid intersit quaeritur: alter, cum quid praestet aliud alii quaeritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:29:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 29, 117</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">116: potest incidere saepe contentio et comparatio, de duobus honestis utrum honestius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 43, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorum, minorum, parium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 18, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis suae cum scriptis alienis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in comparatione alicujus (post-Aug.): strata erant itinera vilioribus sarcinis, quas in conparatione meliorum avaritia contempserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 20</bibl></cit> Vogel ad loc.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ex conparatione regis novi, desiderium excitabatur amissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 15, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9522.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n9522.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A trial of skill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in comparationem se demittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9522.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A relation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comparison</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum solis et lunae et quinque errantium ad eandem inter se comparationem est facta conversio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9522.5" n="C" level="2"> Translation of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)nalogi/a</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n9522.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract</hi> (v. 1. comparo, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">provincia sine sorte, sine comparatione, extra ordinem data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 30, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9522.7" n="E" level="2"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">a coupling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pairing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9522.8" n="F" level="1"> In rhet.: <cit><quote lang="la">criminis,</quote> <trans><tr>a defensive comparison of a crime with a good deed</tr>, <tr>on account of which the crime was committed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:11:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 11, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 24, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 14, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9522.9" n="G" level="1"> In gram. </sense><sense id="n9522.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A climax</hi>, Don. p. 1745 P.—</sense><sense id="n9522.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The comparative degree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9523" type="main" key="compa^ra_ti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compărātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. comparo</etym>. <sense id="n9523.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A preparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">providing for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparation</hi>, etc. (rare, but in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">novi belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae, Auct. B. Afr. 35: veneni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparatio disciplinaque dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:263" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 76, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novae amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 6</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="COMP" /> </sense><sense id="n9523.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A procuring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquiring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 21, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of all the materials for an accusation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:67:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 67, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ego ita credo, ut nihil de meā comparatione deminuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:5:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9523.2" n="B" level="2"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">a purchasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchase</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:41" default="NO">41, 3, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comparative: <entryFree id="n9524" type="main" key="compa^ra_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compărātīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. comparativus.</entryFree>
comparativus: <entryFree id="n9525" type="main" key="compa^ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compărātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. comparo</etym>, <sense id="n9525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to comparison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depending on comparison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comparative.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9525.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">judicatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:25:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 25, 76</bibl></cit> (cf. 1. comparatio, I.): <cit><quote lang="la">genus causae (opp. simplex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 21, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">compărātīva</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">words in the comparative degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comparatives</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 19</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">compărā-tīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with comparison</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 21, 14</bibl></cit>; Ambros. de Fide, 5, 9, 71.—</sense><sense id="n9525.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. in gram. </sense><sense id="n9525.3" n="A" level="2"> Gradus, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the comparative</hi>, Don. p. 1745 P. et saep.—</sense><sense id="n9525.4" n="B" level="2"> Casus, <hi rend="ital">the ablative</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 671</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
comparator: <entryFree id="n9526" type="main" key="compa^ra_tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compărātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. comparo</etym>, <sense id="n9526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purchaser</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sen. 2, 17, 15</bibl>; Cod. Th. 10, 33, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9527" type="main" key="compa^ra_tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compărātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. comparo</etym>, <sense id="n9527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comparer</hi>: litterarum, Julian. Epit. Nov. c. 44, § 177.</sense></entryFree>
comparatus: <entryFree id="n9528" type="hapax" key="compa^ratus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compăra-tus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a relation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proportion</hi> (cf. 1. comparatio, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">modulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
comparco: <entryFree id="n9529" type="main" key="comparco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-parco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">comperco</orth> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22, 17</bibl>), parsi or <itype>persi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to save</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husband well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay up</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n9529.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ille compersit miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Laud. Neglig. 2, p. 371" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Laud. Neglig. 2, p. 371</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pan. Theod. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9529.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to abstain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forbear;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conperce, amabo, me attrectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 137</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=60:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 60, 5</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
compareo: <entryFree id="n9530" type="main" key="compa_re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pārĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>ui, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n9530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be perfectly evident</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apparent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be visible</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n9530.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui modo nusquam conparebas, nunc quom conpares peris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ego ad omnis conparebo tibi res benefactis frequens ( = in omnibus rebus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: nec tamen ulla Comparebat avis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1220</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis suspitio in eos servos, qui non comparebant, commovebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente comparuit incolumis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 14</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:234" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 71, 234</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato, 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequaquam argenti ratio conparet,</quote> <trans><tr>agrees</tr>, <tr>is correct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 26, 73</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> —</sense><sense id="n9530.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (effectus pro causa), <hi rend="ital">to be present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be in existence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et memor sum et diligens, ut quae imperes, conpareant,</quote> <trans><tr>may be done</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa et dona comparere omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:50:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 50, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Thucydide orbem modo orationis desidero, ornamenta comparent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:234" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 71, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conquiri quae comparerent jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 40, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 35, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 30, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 24, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 410</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comparilis: <entryFree id="n9531" type="main" key="compa^ri^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-părĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n9531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">equal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">figurae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comparo: <entryFree id="n9532" type="main" key="compa^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compăro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>compar</etym>, <sense id="n9532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to couple together in the same relation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to connect in pairs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">match</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquid cum aliquā re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alicui rei</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliqua inter se</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9532.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n9532.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inter ignem et terram aquam deus animamque poneret, eaque inter se compararet et proportione conjungeret, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparari postremo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambo cum simul aspicimus, non possumus non vereri, ne male comparati sitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Volumnius cum Ap. Claudio consul est factus, priore item consulatu inter se conparati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 15, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labella cum labellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: quin meum senium cum dolore tuo conjungam et comparem, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 255, 31</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 90 Rib.).— Hence, </sense><sense id="n9532.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. of combatants, for the usu. compono, <hi rend="ital">to bring together to a contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to match</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ego cum patrono disertissimo comparer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Aesernino Samnite Pacideianus comparatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 257, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipio et Hannibal, velut ad supremum certamen comparati duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc Threci comparavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9532.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9532.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To couple together in judgment.</hi><cb n="COMP" />  </sense><sense id="n9532.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To count one object fully equal to another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to place on the same footing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put on an equality with</hi> (rare but class.): neminem tibi profecto hominem ex omnibus aut anteposuissem umquam aut etiam comparassem, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 256, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphic. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphic. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 28, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:98" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:65 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 65 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quibus (hominibus) comparari sordidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 30, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et se mihi comparat Ajax?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 338</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9532.7" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to place together in comparison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to compare</hi> (the usu. signif. of the word in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">homo quod rationis est particeps similitudines comparat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majora, minora, paria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:40:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 40, 172</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 18, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metaphora rei comparatur, quam volumus exprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi fortis et victoris senectuti, comparat suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si regiae stirpi comparetur ignobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restat ut copiae copiis conparentur vel numero vel, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se majori pauperiorum turbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Periclem fulminibus et caelesti fragori comparat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse est sibi nimium tribuat, qui se nemini comparat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tantum inutilibus comparantur utilia, sed inter se quoque ipsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 33</bibl></cit>; cf <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 87</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem cum homine et tempus cum tempore et rem cum re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:51:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 51, 130</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:54:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 54, § 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illo... ceteris rebus nullo modo comparandus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:46:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 46, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum meum factum cum tuo comparo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis commoda cum externis et ipsa inter se corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longiorem orationem cum magnitudine utilitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria, quae cum Marathonio possit comparari tropaeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam causam nostram cum tota adversarii causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:3" default="NO">12, 7, 3</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec comparandus hic quidem ad illum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed nihil comparandi causā loquar,</quote> <trans><tr>I will institute no comparison</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n9532.8" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reflect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judge;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to prove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by comparing</hi> (rare): id ego semper mecum sic agito et comparo, quo pacto magnam molem minuam, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 256, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum comparetur, utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 28, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparando quam intestina corporis seditio similis esset irae plebis in patres, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde comparat, quanto plures deleti sint homines, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9532.9" n="B" level="2"> Comparare inter se, t. t., of colleagues in office, <hi rend="ital">to agree together in respect to the division of duties</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come to an agreement</hi> (freq. in Liv., esp. of the consuls, who made an arrangement between themselves in respect to their provinces): <cit><quote lang="la">inter se decemviri comparabant, quos ire ad bellum, quos praeesse exercitibus oporteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 41, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsultum factum est, ut consules inter se provincias Italiam et Macedoniam compararent sortirenturve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 31, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 8, 1</bibl>; 33, 43, 2; 26, 8, 8; <cit><quote lang="la">41, 6, 1: (consules) comparant inter se ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 15, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut consules sortirentur conparerentve inter se, uter, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the tribunes of the people,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 20, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the proprætors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 47, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9532.10" n="C" level="2"> (In acc. with I. B.) Si scias quod donum huic dono contra comparet, <hi rend="ital">opposes to this</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 63</bibl>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">compărātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by comparison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comparatively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere (opp. simpliciter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:22:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 22, 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9533" type="main" key="compa^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-păro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (old form conparassit = comparaverit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 19</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n9533.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To prepare something with zeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">care</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to make ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide</hi>, etc. (class.) </sense><sense id="n9533.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnifice et ornate convivium comparat (al. apparat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:42" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi remedium ad magnitudinem frigorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>: se, <hi rend="ital">to make one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prepare one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad respondendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 33, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 43, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad omnis casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias alicui per aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 16, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dolum ad capiendos eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparare et constituere accusationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">comparare accusatorem filio suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:67:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 67, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: domicilium <pb n="387" /> <cb n="COMP" /> ibi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter ad regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum e vultu,</quote> <trans><tr>to adjust according to</tr>, <tr>to fashion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In the histt. freq. of preparations for war: bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 29, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 28, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 1, 1</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">arma, milites, classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 30, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 1</bibl>; id.
