Dion, 4, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 4, 1</bibl> and 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arma latroni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> in mid. force: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fiet ut isdem locis et ad suadendum et ad dissuadendum simus conparati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoc colloquio legati Romani in Boeotiam conparati sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>made ready to go</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 43, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9533.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac parte diligentissime comparatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempore ad comparandum dato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 45, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 12, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9533.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urere tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:267" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ita me comparem, Non perpeti, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>place myself in a condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9533.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> of the arrangements of nature, of civil life, of manners, customs, etc., <hi rend="ital">to arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">establish;</hi> esp. in the <hi rend="ital">pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita quoique est in aetate hominum conparatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 94</bibl> Fleck.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">more majorum comparatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:53:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 53, 153</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita comparatum more majorum erat, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 29, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est ita natura comparatum ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetores, ut considerate fieret, comparaverunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 51</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 16, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam hoc prope iniquissime comparatum est, quod in morbis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 21, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eis utendum censeo quae legibus conparata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 8</bibl></cit>.—So rarely of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">sic fuimus semper comparati, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 9, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9533.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To procure what one does not yet possess</hi> or <hi rend="ital">what is not yet in existence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to procure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collect.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9533.6" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">negoti sibi qui volet vim parare, Navem et mulierem haec duo conparato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi quadraginta minas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum ac vestem atque alia, quae opus sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudes carius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex incommodis Alterius sua ut comparent commoda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sthenius ab adulescentio paulo studiosius haec compararat, supellectilem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34:section=83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34, § 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmas, toreumata, signa, tabulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 47</bibl></cit>: victum et cultum humanum labore et industriā, Cic. Oecon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12</bibl>, praef. § 2: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9533.7" n="2" level="3"> Of abstract things: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunicium auxilium sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34, 3 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:30" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9533.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: sex (tribunos) ad intercessionem comparavere, <hi rend="ital">brought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gained them over to their side</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:48:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 48, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comparticeps: <entryFree id="n9534" type="main" key="comparti^ceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-partĭceps</orth>, <itype>tĭcĭpis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n9534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">partaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participants together</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">promissionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Eph. 3, 5</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
compartior: <entryFree id="n9535" type="main" key="comparti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-partĭor</orth>, <itype>īri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n9535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to divide something with one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to share</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">MVNERA CVM ALIQVO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4040</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellectum prudentiae sapientia compartietur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 1, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compartiri altario,</quote> <trans><tr>to be made partaker of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Serm. Dom. 54.</sense></entryFree>
comparturio: <entryFree id="n9536" type="main" key="compartu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-partŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n9536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be associated in childbirth</hi> with any one, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Hexaem. 4, 8, 31</bibl>; id. de Fide, 1, 14, 87.</sense></entryFree>
compasco: <entryFree id="n9537" type="main" key="compasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pasco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">con-</orth>), no <sense id="n9537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>pastum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9537.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To feed together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feed in common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si compascuus ager est, jus est compascere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 5, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9537.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To feed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pasture</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Brundisiana (ostrea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9537.3" n="B" level="2"> Pregn. </sense><sense id="n9537.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To consume by feeding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 5; so in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9537.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To drive away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> by feeding: <cit><quote lang="la">famem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 54, 79, § 169</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compascuus: <entryFree id="n9538" type="main" key="compascu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pascŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n9538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to common pasturage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <trans><tr>a common pasture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; Lex Thor.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3121</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=40:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 40, 1</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">jus compascui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 5, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compassibilis: <entryFree id="n9539" type="hapax" key="compassi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compassĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>compatior</etym>, <sense id="n9539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suffering with one</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compassio: <entryFree id="n9540" type="main" key="compassi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compassĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fellow-suffering</hi>,<cb n="COMP" />  <hi rend="ital">fellow-feeling</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res Carn. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiarum,</quote> <trans><tr>sympathy</tr>, <tr>agreement</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
compastor: <entryFree id="n9541" type="hapax" key="compastor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pastor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-herdsman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 187" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compastus: <entryFree id="n9542" type="main" key="compastus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compastus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from compasco.</entryFree>
compatior: <entryFree id="n9543" type="main" key="compa^ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pătĭor</orth>, <itype>passus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (late Lat.). <sense id="n9543.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To suffer with one</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:16:98" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 16, 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9543.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To have compassion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feel pity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 40:29:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 40, 29, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Conf. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compatriota: <entryFree id="n9544" type="gloss" key="compatri^o_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-patrĭōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-citizen</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">sumpoli/ths</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
compatronus: <entryFree id="n9545" type="main" key="compa_^tro_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pā^trōnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-patron</hi> (Lat. of jurists), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:4:3:section=4 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 4, 3, § 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:5:1" default="NO">38, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compauper: <entryFree id="n9546" type="main" key="compauper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pauper</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a companion in poverty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fellow-pauper</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 25" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 25</bibl> ex 50 homil. c. 3.</sense></entryFree>
compavesco: <entryFree id="n9547" type="main" key="compa^vesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-păvesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n9547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be thoroughly terrified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be very much afraid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:23:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 23, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compavio: <entryFree id="n9548" type="main" key="compa^vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compăvĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n9548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a.;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">perf. part. pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">compăvītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">beaten</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 197, 24</bibl> (al. aliter).</sense></entryFree>
compeccator: <entryFree id="n9549" type="main" key="compecca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compeccātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-sinner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 112, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compecco: <entryFree id="n9550" type="main" key="compecco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pecco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n9550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to err</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commit a fault together</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
compeciscor: <entryFree id="n9551" type="main" key="compe^ciscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕciscor</orth>, v. compaciscor.</entryFree>
compectum: <entryFree id="n9552" type="main" key="compectum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compectum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">compectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. compaciscor.</entryFree>
compedes: <entryFree id="n9553" type="main" key="compe^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. compes.</entryFree>
compedio: <entryFree id="n9554" type="main" key="compe^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕdĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), no <sense id="n9554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ĭtum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>compes</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shackle</hi> (mostly anteand post-class.). </sense><sense id="n9554.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: pedes corrigiis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 28, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi conpediti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 10:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:7:section=7 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 3, 7, § 7 al.</bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n9554.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus immortalibus perniciosissime compediri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 39" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compedus: <entryFree id="n9555" type="main" key="compe^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fettering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shackling</hi>: linea (i. e. compes), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 28, 9</bibl>, and p. 451, 25.</sense></entryFree>
compellatio: <entryFree id="n9556" type="main" key="compella_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compellātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. compello</etym>. <sense id="n9556.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an accosting</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 15, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9556.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. with reproach, <hi rend="ital">a reprimand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebuke</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 7, 17</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compello: <entryFree id="n9557" type="main" key="compello1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pello</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>pŭli, pulsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive together to a place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to collect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assemble</hi> (opp. expello, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 7, 16</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">to dispellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 149</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and to aspellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; class.). </sense><sense id="n9557.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> of herds, flocks: <cit><quote lang="la">tum compellendum (agnos) in gregem ovium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armentum in speluncam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecoris vim ingentem in saltum avium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus totius provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 87</bibl></cit>: haedorum gregem hibisco (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for ad hibiscum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 30</bibl>.—Also of other objects: <cit><quote lang="la">primordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 564</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines unum in locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves (hostium) in portum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes intra oppida murosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 65</bibl></cit>; so of the driving or forcing of enemies in a body; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarios intra moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem fugatum in naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dardanos in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 19, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidanos intra munimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:11:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes in fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum Medulliam,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn the war thither</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is (hostes) eo compulit ut locorum angustiis clausi, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>drove them into so close corners</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium domum suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad monumentorum deversoria plebe compulsā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>: quam (imaginem) virga semel horrida... Nigro compulerit gregi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa in suas sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n9557.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9557.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">press together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores nostros dispulsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur eam tantas in angustias et in Stoicorum dumeta compellimus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 35, 112</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n9557.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constrain to something;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, more rarely with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9557.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> (freq. in Suet.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad deditionem fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>: ad mortem, id. <cb n="COMP" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:56" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad confessionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pugnam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad rapinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad defectionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:45" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad laqueum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad impudicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9557.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hunc sensum compellor injuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eundem metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 29, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in socordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 27</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9557.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">callidum senem callidis dolis Conpuli et perpuli, mihi omnia ut crederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9557.8" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem jussa nefanda pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:860" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 860</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:35" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:3" default="NO">30, 3</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 237</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteras nationes conterruit, compulit, domuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquā indignatione compellendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:138" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille qui aspellit, is conpellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; freq. in <hi rend="ital">perf. part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculis compulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 30, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9558" type="main" key="compello2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compello</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. compello; cf. 2. appello, āre, from 1. appello, ĕre, and jugare, from root of jungo</etym>, <sense id="n9558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to accost one.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9558.1" n="I" level="1"> Without implying reproach, <hi rend="ital">to accost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">address</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): exin compellare pater me voce videtur his verbis, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 41</bibl> (Ann. v. 45 Vahl.); so, aliquem, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 256 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 161</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">notis vocibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 499</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:839" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 839</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">blande hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiariter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: carmine, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talibus agrestem com pellat Oreada dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 787</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 585</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tauream nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 47, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem multo honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 474</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis amicis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 372</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam de stupro,</quote> <trans><tr>to invite to unchastity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; in like sense <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 57" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9558.2" n="II" level="1"> In a hostile sense, <hi rend="ital">to address one reproachfully</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abusively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebuke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upbraid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take to task</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call to account</hi> (good prose). </sense><sense id="n9558.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">mimus nominatim Accium poëtam compellavit in scaenā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 14, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque aspexit mater, quin eum fratricidam impiumque detestans compellaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro cunctatore segnem, pro cauto timidum compellabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne compellarer inultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 297</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9558.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., jurid. t. t., of authorities, <hi rend="ital">to summon</hi> one to answer a charge; or of adversaries, <hi rend="ital">to arraign one before a tribunal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to accuse of crime</hi> (cf. 2. appello): <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Ciceronem compellat edicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nigidius minari in contione, se judicem, qui non adfuerit, compellaturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 7, 17</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compendiarius: <entryFree id="n9559" type="main" key="compendi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compendĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>compendium</etym>, <sense id="n9559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compendious</hi>, only a few times of ways or roads: via ad gloriam proxima et quasi compendiaria, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12, 43</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2</bibl>, ext. 1.—</sense><sense id="n9559.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n9559.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">compendĭārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. via), <hi rend="ital">a short way</hi> or <hi rend="ital">method;</hi> fig., Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 202, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 119:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 119, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 27:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">breviores etiamnum quaedam picturae compendiariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9559.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">compendĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. iter), the same, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 73:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 73, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compendifacio: <entryFree id="n9560" type="main" key="compendi^fa^cio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compendĭfăcio</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. compendium.</entryFree>
compendio: <entryFree id="n9561" type="main" key="compendi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compendĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>compendium</etym> (eccl. Lat.). <sense id="n9561.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To shorten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abridge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9561.1" n="II" level="1"> Compendiare alicui, lit., <hi rend="ital">to shorten the way of life for one;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to kill him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quaest. in Hept. 7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quaest. in Hept. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
compendiose: <entryFree id="n9562" type="main" key="compendi^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compendĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. compendiosus <sense id="n9562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
compendiosus: <entryFree id="n9563" type="main" key="compendi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compendĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>compendium</etym>. <sense id="n9563.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Advantageous</hi> (opp. damnosus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9563.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Abridged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compendious</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 268, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit>, p. 186, 12: exitus citae mortis, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 334.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">compendĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">compendiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 8, 29</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compendium: <entryFree id="n9564" type="main" key="compendi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compendĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>compendo</etym>, orig. belonging to the lang. of econ., <sense id="n9564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which</hi> <pb n="388" /> <cb n="COMP" /> <hi rend="ital">is weighed together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kept together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saved</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=183" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 183</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=72:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 72, 10</bibl> Müll.); <hi rend="ital">a saving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit acquired by saving</hi> (opp. dispendium; class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n9564.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hodie compendi feci binos panes in dies,</quote> <trans><tr>have saved two loaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem mercibus suppeditandis cum quaestu compendioque dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 46, § 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpe compendium effugere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se negat facturum compendii sui causā quod non liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 15, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines ad turpe compendium commovere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 40, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servire privato compendio suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 36, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 12, 41, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">compendia repetere ignotis terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:39 al" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 39 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 64, § 127</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 214</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:181" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 20, 49, § 181</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9564.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., </sense><sense id="n9564.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Shortness of way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a short way</hi> ( = compendiaria), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">montis,</quote> <trans><tr>a short cut across the mountain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:533" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 533</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:95:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 95, 5</bibl>; Gell. praef. § 12.—</sense><sense id="n9564.4" n="2" level="3"> In the phrases, </sense><sense id="n9564.5" n="a" level="4"> Facere compendium, <hi rend="ital">to make a profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9564.6" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">compendium edepol haud aetati optabile Fecisti, quom istanc nactu's impudentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9564.7" n="(b)" level="5"> More freq. <hi rend="ital">to make a saving</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">be sparing</hi> of a thing: compendium ego te facere pultandi volo, <hi rend="ital">to save your knocking</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to cease therefrom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">errationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeconis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9564.8" n="b" level="4"> Aliquid ponere ad compendium. <hi rend="ital">to save</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spare</hi> something, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not to say it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">coaddito ad compendium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> v. 4.—</sense><sense id="n9564.9" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saving in any thing done</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a shortening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abbreviating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam potes, tam verba confer maxume ad compendium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>be concise</tr>, <tr>brief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 184</bibl></cit>.—So of discourse, etc. (ante-class.): facere or fieri compendi, <hi rend="ital">to shorten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abridge</hi> (the discourse), or <hi rend="ital">to be shortened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abridged</hi>: lamentas fletus facere conpendi licet, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 132, 29</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 175 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">compendi verba multa jam faciam tibi,</quote> <trans><tr>will be very brief with you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis velitationem fieri compendi volo,</quote> <trans><tr>in few words</tr>, <tr>briefly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed jam fieri dictis compendium volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipsis statim elementis etiam brevia docendi monstrare compendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 30</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">compendio morari,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>only a short time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compendo: <entryFree id="n9565" type="hapax" key="compendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">balance together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compendium, quod, cum compenditur, una fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=183" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 183</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
compensatio: <entryFree id="n9566" type="main" key="compensa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compensātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>compenso</etym>, <sense id="n9566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weighing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">balancing of several things together.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9566.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., in the lang. of business, <hi rend="ital">a balancing of accounts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rendering of an equivalent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equalizing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compensatio est debiti et crediti inter se distributio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:15" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 24, 3, 15</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 66 sq.</bibl>: mercium, <hi rend="ital">an exchange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barter</hi> (opp. pecunia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 2, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9566.2" n="II" level="1"> Trop (only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">hac usurum conpensatione sapientem, ut voluptatem fugiat, si ea majorem doiorem effectura sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:33:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 33, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incommoda commodorum conpensatione lenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:9:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compensativus: <entryFree id="n9567" type="main" key="compensa_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compensātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving for compensating</hi> (late Lat.), Victor. Rhet. 1, p. 137; 2, p. 217.</sense></entryFree>
compensato: <entryFree id="n9568" type="main" key="compensa_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compensātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. compenso <sense id="n9568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
compenso: <entryFree id="n9569" type="main" key="compenso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-penso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to poise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh several things with one another;</hi> hence, in the lang. of business, <hi rend="ital">to equalize one thing with another by weighing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to balance with one another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compensate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">balance against</hi>, lit. and trop. (class. in prose and poetry; most freq. in Cic.); constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquid cum aliquā re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquā re</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9569.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n9569.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Cum aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne compensabit cum uno versiculo tot mea volumina laudum suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:30:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 30, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiam cum doloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 30, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona cum vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9569.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summi labores nostri magnā compensati gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 5, 13</bibl> (1, 3): <cit><quote lang="la">damna ab aliquo aetatis fructu compensata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13, § 33</bibl></cit>: o vix ullo otio compensandam hanc rei <cb n="COMP" /> publicae turpitudinem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:69:231" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 69, 231</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucitatem pedum gravitatis suae (sc. spondei) tarditate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 64, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot amissis te unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 51</bibl></cit>: pecuniam pedibus, <hi rend="ital">to make up for the low price in shoe-leather</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 29, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinora ministerio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: reprehendens aliā laude compenses, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 87</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n9569.4" n="II" level="1"> In post-Aug. poets, of a way, <hi rend="ital">to shorten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">save</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longum iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 83" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 83</bibl></cit> (cf. pensare iter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 685</bibl>).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">compensātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">with compensation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reward</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2</bibl> (al. leg. compensati).</sense></entryFree>
comperco: <entryFree id="n9570" type="main" key="comperco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comperco</orth>, v. comparco.</entryFree>
comperegrinus: <entryFree id="n9571" type="hapax" key="compe^re_^gri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pĕrē^grīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellowstranger</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
comperendinatio: <entryFree id="n9572" type="main" key="compe^rendi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕrendĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>comperendino</etym>, <sense id="n9572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deferring of the time</hi> (<hi rend="ital">of trial</hi>) <hi rend="ital">to the third day</hi> or <hi rend="ital">later</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 97:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 97, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 38</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9572.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">delay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullā comperendinatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comperendinatus: <entryFree id="n9573" type="main" key="compe^rendi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕrendĭnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, i. q. comperendinatio, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 22, 87</bibl>.</entryFree>
comperendino: <entryFree id="n9574" type="main" key="compe^rendi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕrendĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>comperendinus</etym>, jurid. t. t.; prop. of the judge, <sense id="n9574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cite a defendant to a new time of trial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appointed on the third following day</hi> or <hi rend="ital">later</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 7, § 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9574.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of the party which demands the deferring: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ante primos ludos comperendinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 11, 34</bibl></cit> Klotz ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
comperendinus: <entryFree id="n9575" type="main" key="compe^rendi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pĕrendĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: dies, <sense id="n9575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the third following day to which a trial was deferred</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compereo: <entryFree id="n9576" type="gloss" key="compe^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pĕrĕo</orth>, <itype>ĭi, īre</itype>, <sense id="n9576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to perish together</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 1, p. 369</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
comperio: <entryFree id="n9577" type="main" key="compe^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pĕrĭo</orth>, <itype>pĕri, pertum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root par-, of paro, pario; cf. 2. comparo, and aperio, operio, etc.; by others separated from these words and referred to root per-, of <foreign lang="greek">peira/w</foreign>, peritus, periculum; but cf. Corss. Ausspr. II. 410</etym>, lit., <sense id="n9577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disclose wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay open</hi> (a fact), without the access. idea of communicating the thing disclosed (which aperio expresses; v. aperio); <hi rend="ital">to obtain a knowledge of a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to find out with certainty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gain certain information</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ascertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learn</hi>, etc. (class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">certo comperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum indicia mortis se comperisse manifesto et manu tenere diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:277" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 80, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de amore hoc comperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil de hoc (Sullā) consul comperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 31, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 68:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 68, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam de scelere filii comperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:6 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 6 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam comperit eum posse vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc gentem Clusium inde venisse comperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 24</bibl>: diram qui contudit hydram, comperit invidiam supremo fine domari, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi comperi ex eis qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 68, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per exploratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certis auctoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil testibus, nihil tabulis, nihil aliquo gravi argumento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:45:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 45, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo ut rem gestam comperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ex fratre compererat nuntiari regi jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut postea ex captivis comperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:17" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:8:36" default="NO">8, 36</bibl>.—Cicero, on account of the frequent repetition of the phrase omnia comperi, in the trial of Catiline, was often bantered by his contemporaries; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: (Clodius) me tantum comperisse omnia criminabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 5, 2</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">depend. question</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolo an vere cunctatus, parum comperimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 113:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 113, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:67:3" default="NO" valid="yes">67, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9577.1" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp. freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oppianici facinus manifesto compertum atque deprehensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego haec incertis jacta rumoribus adfero ad vos, sed comperta et explorata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 18, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 21, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sintne haec investigata, comperta, patefacta per me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam ex aerario scribae viatoresque aedilicii clam egessisse per indicem comperti,</quote> <trans><tr>discovered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 39, 7</bibl></cit>: compertus adulterare<cb n="COMP" />  matronas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem in stupro generi compertam,</quote> <trans><tr>detected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 35</bibl></cit>.—Also with the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of the crime: <cit><quote lang="la">compertus stupri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 57, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:11:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 11, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">probri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrilegii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de his haud facile compertum narraverim,</quote> <trans><tr>give certain information</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex fratre comperta ipsi nuntiasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:8:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ex vate comperta nuntiabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 7, 22</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: comperto lege Gabiniā Bithyniam et Pontum consuli datam, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1130</bibl> P.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 39, 4</bibl> and 7; 33, 5, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 13</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 14, 57.—So, also, compertum habeo and compertum mihi est, <hi rend="ital">I know full well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod de his duobus habuerint compertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:45:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 45, 127</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:22" default="NO" valid="yes">22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro comperto polliceri,</quote> <trans><tr>as certain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">compertē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">on good authority;</hi> only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 9</bibl>; and in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comperior: <entryFree id="n9578" type="main" key="compe^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕrĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>īri, pertus sum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, collat. form of comperio, q. v., <sense id="n9578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ascertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain certain knowledge that</hi>, etc. (rare); constr. mostly with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ne ab hoc me falli comperiar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 45, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:108:3" default="NO" valid="yes">108, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid comperior?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 124, 11</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compernis: <entryFree id="n9579" type="main" key="compernis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pernis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perna</etym>, <sense id="n9579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with the knees bent inwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knock-kneed</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 26, 3</bibl>; Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375:20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375, 20</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 10</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
comperpetuus: <entryFree id="n9580" type="hapax" key="comperpe^tu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-perpĕtŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n9580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coeternal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 339</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comperte: <entryFree id="n9581" type="main" key="comperte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compertē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. comperio <sense id="n9581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
compertus: <entryFree id="n9582" type="main" key="compertus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. comperio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9583" type="main" key="compertus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compertus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>comperio</etym>, <sense id="n9583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">experience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">personal knowledge</hi> (late Lat. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">compertu evidentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 103 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
compes: <entryFree id="n9584" type="main" key="compe_s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pēs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen> <case>acc.</case> compedem meum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 3, 7</bibl>; <number>plur.</number> compedes parati, Lact. Mort. Persec. c. 21), <sense id="n9584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (wooden) <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shackle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the feet</hi> (usu. in <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n9584.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubete huic crassas conpedis inpingier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut istas conpedis Tibi adimam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 19</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> conpedium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 15</bibl>, <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">conpedibus levior filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 28</bibl></cit>; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:182" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 182</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">sing. gen.</hi> compedis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. prol. 2, 3</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> compedem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 3, 7</bibl>; <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">durā compede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:42" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 80</bibl></cit> (<case>nom.</case> and <case>dat.</case> of <number>sing.</number> apparently not in use).—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">compedes, quas ipse fecit, ipsus ut gestet faber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n9584.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fetlers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bonds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chains</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum Philippum compedes eas (urbes) Graeciae appellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grata (of the chains of love),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratā compede vinctum aliquem puella tenet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivali compede vinctus Hebrus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: aërias corpori imponere, of adverse winds, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 28, 13</bibl>.—And of a hinderance in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">has compedes, fasces inquam hos laureatos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9584.3" n="B" level="2"> As a female ornament of silver, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 54, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n9585" type="main" key="compes2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compes</orth>, i. q. compos, acc, to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1, p. 553</bibl>.</entryFree>
compesco: <entryFree id="n9586" type="main" key="compesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compesco</orth>, <itype>pescui</itype> (pescitum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 887</bibl> P.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>compes</etym>, <sense id="n9586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fasten together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to confine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold in check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to repress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.; the words quoted as from Cic. by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:169" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 169</bibl>: quin compescitis vocem istam? ap. Cic. himself, Rab. Perd. 8, 18, are: quin continetis vocem). </sense><sense id="n9586.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramos fluentes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to clip</tr>, <tr>prune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 370</bibl></cit>;
