<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatiantia bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 630</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignibus ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:313" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 33</bibl></cit> (43), 2: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriosam vitem fructu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 21, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:32:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 32, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: coërceo cretam, <hi rend="ital">to tread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stamp</hi>, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 245, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum angustis habenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos ocellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiosum civem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9586.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to suppress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, etc.: seditionem<pb n="389" /> <cb n="COMP" />  exercitūs verbo uno, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiles motus per legatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitim multā undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 102</bibl></cit>: maledicta hinc aufer; <cit><quote lang="la">linguam compescas face,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. querellas. * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:954" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 954</bibl> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">tristitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 63</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">vino dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam frenis et catenā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardorem (together with temperavit vim suam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores dissolutos vi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9586.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave malum et compesce in illum dicere injuste,</quote> <trans><tr>cease</tr>, <tr>forbear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
competens: <entryFree id="n9587" type="main" key="compe^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕtens</orth>, v. competo <sense id="n9587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
competenter: <entryFree id="n9588" type="main" key="compe^tenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕtenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. competo <sense id="n9588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
competentia: <entryFree id="n9589" type="main" key="compe^tenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕtentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>competo</etym> (postclass.), <sense id="n9589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a meeting together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrorum inter se,</quote> <trans><tr>symmetry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 19, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9589.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., of the stars, <hi rend="ital">conjunction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aspect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasci ad eandem competentiam (sc. siderum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:26" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6, 24 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
competitio: <entryFree id="n9590" type="main" key="compe^ti_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕtītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (late Lat.). <sense id="n9590.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An agreement</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9590.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A judicial demand</hi>, Cod. Th. 2, 23, 1.—</sense><sense id="n9590.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rivalry</hi>, Ambros. de Elia, 21, 79.</sense></entryFree>
competitor: <entryFree id="n9591" type="main" key="compe^ti_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕtītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rival</hi>, <hi rend="ital">competitor</hi> (in good prose); <cit><quote lang="la">in gen.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:57:15" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 57, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:29" default="NO">7, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:97" default="NO">9, 2, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:2:3:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 2, 3, § 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9591.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a plaintiff</hi>, Cod. Th. 10, 9, 2.</sense></entryFree>
competitrix: <entryFree id="n9592" type="hapax" key="compe^ti_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕtītrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>competitor</etym>, <sense id="n9592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female competitor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:19:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 19, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
competo: <entryFree id="n9593" type="main" key="compe^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pĕto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>īvi or ii, ītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (first common since the Aug. per.; very rare before that time; not found in Cic., and perh. not in the poets). <sense id="n9593.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strive after something in company</hi> or <hi rend="ital">together</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">unum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unam speciosam (puellam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 59" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 59</bibl></cit>: bona, Cod. Th. 10, 10, 27, § 6.—</sense><sense id="n9593.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to meet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come together.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9593.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi viae competunt, tum in compitis sacrificatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 25</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi recti angulorum conpetant ictuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 18, 16, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cacumina harundinum in unum competunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:17:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9593.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9593.4" n="1" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to coincide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to happen</hi>, etc.; constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora reputantibus initium finemque miraculi cum Othonis exitu competisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasti adeo turbati, ut neque messium feriae aestati, neque vindemiarum auctumno competerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si competant coitus lunae in novissimum diem brumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 74, § 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:232" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 26, 63, § 232</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ita competit, ut idem ille, qui sanare potest, disserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 75:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 75, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9593.5" n="2" level="3"> Of other things, <hi rend="ital">to agree</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coincide with something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to answer to it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto Othonis animo nequaquam corpus aut habitus competiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be qualified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">competent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to correspond</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque animo neque auribus aut linguā conpetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 88</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux velut captus animi non linguā, non auribus competere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut assumere in causam naturas, quā competent, aut mitigare, quā repugnabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vix ad arma capienda aptandaque pugnae competeret animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei loci situs ita competit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:5:1" default="NO">9, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cujusquam neptium suarum competeret aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:2" default="NO">2, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:4" default="NO">2, 20, 4</bibl>; 4, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n9593.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To belong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be due to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actionem competere in equitem Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi adversus te actio competit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena competit in aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 243, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas competit, alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas servo competere potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9593.7" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pĕtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n9593.8" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Corresponding to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">personae rebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio etymologiae cum sententiā vocabuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:13:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, Auct. Pan. Maxim. et Const. 7.—</sense><sense id="n9593.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Competent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">legal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:35:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 3, 35, § 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9593.10" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕten-ter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">suitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">properly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">becomingly</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">consulere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">punire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:16" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 22, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: disserere, <cb n="COMP" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Helv. 2</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti Platone,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 316, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
competum: <entryFree id="n9594" type="main" key="compe^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕtum</orth>, v. compitum.</entryFree>
compilatio: <entryFree id="n9595" type="hapax" key="compi_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compīlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>compilo</etym>, lit., <sense id="n9595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a raking together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plundering;</hi> hence, concr., sportively of a collection of documents, <hi rend="ital">a compilation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chresti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compilator: <entryFree id="n9596" type="main" key="compi_la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compīlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plunderer</hi>: veterum, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Virgil</hi> (on account of his imitation of Homer, Ennius, etc.), acc. to Hier. praef. Hebr. Quaest. in Genes., and <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compilo: <entryFree id="n9597" type="main" key="compi_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pīlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to snatch together and carry off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rob</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n9597.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., with <case>acc.</case> of person or thing robbed: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si malui compilari quam venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem, exercitum, provinciamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:13:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 13, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa omnibus ornamentis compilata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum oppidum ostiatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne te (servi) compilent fugientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum (Jovem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> of thing taken: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi vir compilet clanculum, quicquid domi'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9597.2" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cudgel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beat soundly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 196, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>, p. 218, 7.—</sense><sense id="n9597.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crispini scrinia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compingo: <entryFree id="n9598" type="main" key="compingo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pingo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>pēgi, pactum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>con-pango</etym>. <sense id="n9598.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To join</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unite several parts into one whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make by joining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi> (in <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> mostly in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n9598.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">roboreis axibus compingitur solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:19:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem iisdem tabulis (opp. dissolvo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:83" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Argo compacta manu Palladiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 365" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">PONTEM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casam male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:72" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput tenuissimis ossiculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crepidas sibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 9 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum unum ex multitudine et negotio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:16:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graece nescio quid ais te compegisse, quod ut aeque pauca scripta, placeat tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tam compositum tamque conpactum et coagmentatum inveniri potest?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula disparibus septem cicutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 674</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra animantum,</quote> <trans><tr>framed together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:919" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 919</bibl></cit>; cf. under <pos>P. a.</pos> —</sense><sense id="n9598.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">falsa de Christo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulas ignominiosas de diis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, p. 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9598.3" n="II" level="1"> Compingere aliquem or aliquid aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to confine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lock up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi> (several times in Plaut. and Cic., elsewh. rare). </sense><sense id="n9598.4" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 39</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsam (Rheam) in vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in Appuliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum atque argentum ubi omne conpactum fuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9598.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae parentis tam in angustum tuos locum conpegeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in judicia et contiunculas, tamquam in aliquod pistrinum, detrudi et compingi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aufer, utere (pallā), vel tu vel tua uxor, vel etiam in loculos compingite,</quote> <trans><tr>keep it</tr>, <tr>thrust it into your pockets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 3, 17</bibl></cit> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">compactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, of figure or form, <hi rend="ital">compact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thick-set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi> (freq. in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">compacto corpore et robusto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: compactis firmisque membris, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:6" default="NO">6, 37, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">compactā et torosā cervice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 11, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9599" type="main" key="compingo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pingo</orth>, <itype>pinxi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to paint over;</hi> only trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristarchi ineptiae, quibus aliena carmina compinxit,</quote> <trans><tr>disguised</tr>, <tr>covered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:39" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compinguesco: <entryFree id="n9600" type="hapax" key="compinguesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pinguesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n9600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thicken to a solid substance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compitalaris: <entryFree id="n9601" type="main" key="compi^ta_la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĭtālāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. compitalis.</entryFree>
compitalicius: <entryFree id="n9602" type="main" key="compi^ta_li^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĭtālĭcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>compitalis</etym>, <sense id="n9602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> compitalia: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambulationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
compitalis: <entryFree id="n9603" type="main" key="compi^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>compitum</etym>, <sense id="n9603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the cross-ways</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 25</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl> (qui compita servant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:615" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 615</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 140</bibl> sq.).—</sense><sense id="n9603.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n9603.2" n="A" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">compĭtāles</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">priests of the</hi> Lares compitales: <cit><quote lang="la">COMPIT. LAR. AVG.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3958 sq.</bibl></cit>— <cb n="COMP" /> </sense><sense id="n9603.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">compĭtālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium and iōrum</itype> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 27 sq.</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 744</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">compitaliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 4, 8</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>), <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a festival</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annually celebrated at cross - roads</hi> (compita) <hi rend="ital">in honor of the Lares</hi>, soon after the Saturnalia, on a day appointed by the prætor (cf. conceptivus, II.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 25</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">57, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 27, 70, § 204</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=40:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 40, 3</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=257:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 257, 1</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
compitum: <entryFree id="n9604" type="main" key="compi^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compĭtum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">compĕtum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 25</bibl> Müll.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (mostly in <number>plur.</number>; in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=43" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 43</bibl> Müll., and in <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 94, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=174:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 174, 7</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:10:12:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 10, 12, § 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Test. Anim. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">compĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Varr. and Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 196, 9 sq.</bibl>) [competo], <sense id="n9604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where several ways meet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cross - way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cross - road</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 382</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 23; 4 (5), 3, 57; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:142" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 142</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 615</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">compita Larum (Romae) CCLXV.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9604.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (with allusion to the fable of the Choice of Hercules), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:35" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 35</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9604.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res Carn. 60</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">an altar raised at cross-roads</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 483</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 107, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
complaceo: <entryFree id="n9605" type="main" key="compla^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-plăcĕo</orth>, <itype>plăcŭi and plăcĭtus sum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (except in Col., only ante- and postclass.). <sense id="n9605.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be pleasing at the same time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to please also</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam me amare dixi, complacita'st tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: ut et tibi et Gallioni nostro complacuerat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:16:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 16, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9605.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be very pleasing to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneri haec complacuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc deo complacitum'st,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus sibi complacitam formam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 157</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 12</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">complăcĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pleased</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 119</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus, complacitior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:76:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 76, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
complaco: <entryFree id="n9606" type="hapax" key="compla_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-plāco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to conciliate greatly</hi>: sibi judices, Tiro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
complanator: <entryFree id="n9607" type="hapax" key="compla_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complānātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes level</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 277, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
complano: <entryFree id="n9608" type="main" key="compla_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-plāno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">level</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">plain</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n9608.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">terram tabulā, manibus, pedibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 151, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera, Auct. B. Alex. 63: domum,</quote> <trans><tr>to make even with the ground</tr>, <tr>to pull down</tr>, <tr>raze</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:38:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 38, 101</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n9608.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">complanare et mollire aspera, dura,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to render tolerable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 5:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 5, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
complantatio: <entryFree id="n9609" type="gloss" key="complanta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-plantātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">katafu/teusis</foreign>, <sense id="n9609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a planting</hi>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
complanto: <entryFree id="n9610" type="main" key="complanto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-planto</orth>, no <sense id="n9610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to plant together</hi> (late Lat.); <cit><quote lang="la">only trop.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Abrah. 2, 11, 80 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
complatonicus: <entryFree id="n9611" type="main" key="compla^to_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-plătōnĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-Platonist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
complaudo: <entryFree id="n9612" type="hapax" key="complaudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-plaudo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n9612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to applaud together</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 18, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
complecto: <entryFree id="n9613" type="main" key="complecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complecto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. complector <sense id="n9613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
complector: <entryFree id="n9614" type="main" key="complector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complector</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>plexus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (in signif. mostly coinciding with amplector), prop., <sense id="n9614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to entwine around a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi> (cf. amplector; class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n9614.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9614.2" n="a" level="4"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to clasp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embrace</hi>, as an expression of affection. </sense><sense id="n9614.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi et illam et hospitem Conplexum atque ausculantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 53</bibl></cit>: adcurrit; <cit><quote lang="la">mediam mulierem complectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ille artius puellam amplexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(adulescentem) complexus osculatusque dimiserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum maritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nepotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:786" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 786</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem conplexa tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 21, 47</bibl></cit> (17, 36); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:121" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 121</bibl>.—Of parts of the person: <cit><quote lang="la">dextram euntis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 558</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 494</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmis membra lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genua. in supplication,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9614.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosque inter nos esse conplexos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 28, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conplecti inter se lacrimantes milites coepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 42, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 766</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9614.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in vicem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9614.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequeunt conplecti satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Phr.</hi> Conplectere. <hi rend="ital">Di.</hi> Lubens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contineri qum conplectar non queo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1</bibl>, <pb n="390" /> <cb n="COMP" /> 10, 5.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 134</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9614.7" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to grasp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clasp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vitis) claviculis suis quasi manibus quicquid est nacta complectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(orbis caelestis) extimus, qui reliquos omnis complectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complexi terram maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 731</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi mollis amaracus illum (Ascanium) Floribus et dulci conplectitur umbrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 694</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis complectens undique corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <trans><tr>to mark out around for military purposes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 72</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. G. 8, 74; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of ploughing around,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem obsidione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:51:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 51, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput digitis cruentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus eminentia saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dexterā impendentes ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—Of grasping an adversary in fight: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad stans complecti posset atque contendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum inter se complexi in terram ex equis decidissent... non prius distracti sunt, quam alterum anima relinqueret,</quote> <trans><tr>in contention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9614.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9614.9" n="A" level="2"> Of sleep, <hi rend="ital">to seize upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enfold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sopor fessos complectitur artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 253</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me artior somnus conplexus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9614.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To embrace something intellectually as a whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to comprehend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid cogitatione et mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum et divinum animum cogitatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne caelum totamque cum universo mari terram mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 112</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:17" default="NO">12, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo proxima quaeque meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:70" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei magnitudinem animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:6 al" default="NO">10, 6, 6 al.</bibl>; cf. without <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum conplector animo, quattuor reperio causas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—Without mente, animo, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">perficies ut ego ista innumerabilia complectens nusquam labar?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 35, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum genus judiciorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:12:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 12, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam animi magis quam corporis,</quote> <trans><tr>to consider</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:71:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 71, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:7:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 7, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and without memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9614.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To comprehend a multitude of objects in discourse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in a written representation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to comprise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">express</hi>, <hi rend="ital">describe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explain;</hi> with <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case> or <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia alicujus facta oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum memoriam breviter libro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator autem sic illigat sententiam verbis, ut eam numero quodam complectatur et astricto et soluto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia unā comprehensione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura semel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauca paucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 82</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam his verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—Esp. with sententiā, <hi rend="ital">to sum up in a formal vote</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decree</hi> (of speeches in the Senate): causas complectar ipsā sententiā, <hi rend="ital">in the motion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decree itself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 11, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ut aliquando sententiā complectar, ita censeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 14, 36</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9614.12" n="2" level="3"> In philos. lang., <hi rend="ital">to draw a conclusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make an inference</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:40:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 40, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 29, 47</bibl>; cf. complexio.—</sense><sense id="n9614.13" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To embrace from love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor; to be addicted to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to care for;</hi> with <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem honoribus et beneficiis suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 16, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eum beneficio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem summā benevolentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc omni tuā comitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes caritate cives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem artā familiaritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:11:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 11, 5 al.</bibl></cit>— Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: da te homini; <cit><quote lang="la">complectetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos fortuna complexa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:93:322" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 93, 322</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">artes ingenuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:6:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam eam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:16:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 16, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9614.14" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To embrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">include</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cari sunt parentes, cari liberi, propinqui, familiares, sed omnis omnium caritates patria una complexa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet haec omnia complectatur eversio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:13" default="NO">2, 15, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9614.15" n="F" level="1"> (Causa pro effectu.) <hi rend="ital">To take into possession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay hold of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self master of</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">(philosophiae) vis valet multum, cum est idoneam complexa naturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultatem aliquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures provincias complexus sum quam alii urbes ceperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.!*? * </sense><sense id="n9614.16" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat form <orth extent="full" lang="la">complecto</orth>, ĕre: quando convenit complectite, Pompon. <cb n="COMP" /> ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 472 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n9614.17" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">complector</orth>, <itype>ti</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: invidiosā fortunā complecti, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo uno maleficio scelera omnia complexa esse videantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 37</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 40</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 12, 41</bibl>, the best read. is completur).</sense></entryFree>
complementum: <entryFree id="n9615" type="main" key="comple_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complēmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>compleo</etym>, <sense id="n9615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which fills up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">completes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a complement</hi> (rare; only fig.): numerorum (inania quaedam verba), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:69:230" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 69, 230</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium accusationum,</quote> <trans><tr>that gives them their full weight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: accusationis, Cod. Th. 9, 24, 3.</sense></entryFree>
compleo: <entryFree id="n9616" type="main" key="comple^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-plĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>ēvi, ētum, 2</itype> (contr. forms: complerunt, complerint, complerat, complesse, etc., for compleverunt, etc., very often), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pleo, whence suppleo, plenus</etym>, <sense id="n9616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fill up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill out</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n9616.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of material objects. </sense><sense id="n9616.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., with <case>acc.</case> of place, vessel, etc., filled. </sense><sense id="n9616.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Alone: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes fossam complent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 40</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Hisp. 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tune aut inane quicquam putes esse, cum ita conpleta et conferta sint omnia, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 40, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu, ne compleantur navigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deducunt socii navis et litora conplent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conplebant Laidos aedes (amatores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora quae loca complerent,</quote> <trans><tr>occupy space</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones cum loca Camporum complent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites complent murum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigiles domum Flavii complevere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrobem ad medium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non bene urnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vascula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paginam,</quote> <trans><tr>to fill out</tr>, <tr>write full</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speluncas, of the winds,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 197</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9616.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> of material, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">fossas sarmentis et virgultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum prope caelum... humano genere conpletum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundum animorum multitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 58, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiis omnium gentium circum conplere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naufragorum trepidatione passim natantium flumen conpleverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:62:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 62, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispanias Gallias Italiam monumentis ingentium rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (gradus) ubi accusator concitatis hominibus complerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 34, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus Apolline dignum libris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">late loca milite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves serpentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphoras plumbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas aëneas pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrea messibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complentur moenia et tecta maerentium turbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palatium multitudine et clamoribus complebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgultibus et cratibus et corporibus exanimis complere lossas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: et terrae... stirpium renovatione complentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9616.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conviviumque vicinorum cottidie conpleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum completus jam mercatorum carcer esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:57:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 57, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae causa... ararum conpleverit urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1162</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9616.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n9616.7" n="1" level="3"> In milit. lang. </sense><sense id="n9616.8" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To make the army</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a legion</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">of a full number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones in itinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes pro numero militum complet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 56, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legione completā per maniplos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:119" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9616.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill with men</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem Romanam sociis navalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves colonis pastoribusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 56</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">has (naves) sagittariis tormentisque compleverunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves bis denas aut plures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 327</bibl></cit> Serv.—</sense><sense id="n9616.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impregnate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alias (mulieres),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1249</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1275" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1275</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9616.11" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of light, sound, etc. (freq.). </sense><sense id="n9616.12" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To fill</hi> with light, <hi rend="ital">maké full</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cuncta suā luce conpleat (sol),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundum suā luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terras largā luce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem (luna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:18" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae se cornua lumine complent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod maria ac terras omnis caelumque rigando Conpleat (sol),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 595</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9616.13" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To fill</hi> with sound, <hi rend="ital">cause to resound</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make full</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia clamoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1014" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1014</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1065" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1065</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus querellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 358</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus timendā voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra tinnitibus et murmure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 537</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atria ululatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atria fremitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">fremitu aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit> (3, 8), 37: <cit><quote lang="la">aures (sonus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum clamore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 798" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 798</bibl></cit>: aures sermonibus, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olyb. 31: clamor <cb n="COMP" /> omnia variis terrentium ac paventium vocibus complet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 21, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9616.14" n="c" level="4"> Of odors, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia primo motu ac spiritu suo, vini, unguenti, corporis odore complesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:12:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 12, § 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 17, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9616.15" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dianam (i. e. simulacrum) coronis et floribus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to deck</tr>, <tr>adorn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vortentibus Telebois telis conplebantur corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9616.16" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sate</hi> with food or drink: <cit><quote lang="la">multo cibo et potione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:35:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 35, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se flore Liberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec avis scribitur conchis se solere conplere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9616.17" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9616.18" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To supply fully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish abundantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum omni copiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n9616.19" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fill with any notion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">story</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">completi sunt animi auresque vestrae, me... obsistere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos (milites) bonā spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos robore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia luctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia terrore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta pavore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:10 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 10 al.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem erroris et dementiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem flagitii et formidinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9616.20" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To make complete</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perfect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to finish;</hi> of a promise, <hi rend="ital">to fulfil it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustrationem (annuam) menstruo spatio (luna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">his rebus completis legiones reduci jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 46</bibl></cit> (Dinter, ex conj., comparatis): <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnum erat sacrum, ita ut ante mediam noctem conpleretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 35, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conplent ea beatissimam vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam promissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:49:section=116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 49, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum humanarum sorte completā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:6:6 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 6, 6 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n9616.21" n="2" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gorgias centum et septem conplevit annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum VII. et LXX. annos complesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corvinus centesimum annum complevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:13:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; Lact. Op.
