Am. 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne turbarentur comae, quas componi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:148" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay in proper folds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:156" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 156</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen ante adiit... Quam se composuit, quam circumspexit amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvinum facili manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 160</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">torum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:484" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam libet componere voltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 767</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu composito, ne laeti excessu principis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 16, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tiberius) compositus ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum naturā horridum... efferabat, componens ad speculum in omnem terrorem,</quote> <trans><tr>distorting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.40" n="5" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to adjust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulate</hi>, for the expression of something, or to accord with something; usu. <hi rend="ital">ad aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad abstinentiam rursus, non secus ac modo ad balineum animum vultumque conposui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis ipsius vultus ad id, quod efficere intendimus, compositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrāque manu ad modum aliquid portantium compositā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ge. stum oratoris ad similitudinem saltationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figuram ad imitationem alterius scripturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ad votum composita civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta ad decorem inperi conposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctis ad tristitiam conpositis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 1</bibl></cit>. —Less freq. with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voltus conponere famae Taedet,</quote> <trans><tr>to adapt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:7:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venturis carbasa ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 596</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me quoque mittendis rectum componite telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 717</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nero itinera urbis... veste servili in dissimulationem sui compositus pererrabat,</quote> <trans><tr>disguised</tr>, <tr>made up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 25</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9647.41" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring to a particular form</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dispose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9647.42" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego itinera sic composueram, ut Nonis Quinctilibus Puteolis essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod adest memento Componere aequus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conpositā atque constitutā re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necdum compositis maturisve satis consiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(diem) totum in considerandā causā componendāque posuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 22, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus in cognoscendis componendisque causis consumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 42, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex sententiā omnibus rebus paratis conpositisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 43, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:94:1" default="NO" valid="yes">94, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in senatu cuncta longis aliorum principatibus composita statim decernuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum quae forent firmando Neronis imperio componuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.43" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> of the purpose for which, or the example according to which, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alteri placeat auspicia ista ad utilitatem esse rei publicae conposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:13:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ad voluptatem multitudinis inperitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ad omnes casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:321" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 321</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis igitur in hoc nos componet multa scribendi exercitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:114" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultum victumque non ad nova exempla conponere, sed ut majorum mores suadent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 9:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 9, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9647.44" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To arrange in agreement with others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to agree upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conspire to make</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n9647.45" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: eum allegaverunt, suom qui servom diceret Cum auro esse apud me: conposita est fallacia, <pb n="393" /> <cb n="COMP" /> Ut, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin jam virginem Despondi: res composita'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita causa componitur, ut item palaestritae Bidini peterent ab Epicrate hereditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:22:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 22, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem praedarum cum latronibus conposuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 11</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen ab inimicis Romae conpositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:61:section=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 61, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conpositis inter se rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita conposito dolo digrediuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 111:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 111, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conposito jam consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 53, 3</bibl></cit>: ceteri proditores ea quae composita erant exspectabant; <cit><quote lang="la">convenerat autem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub noctem susurri Compositā repetantur horā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictum jam foedus, et omnes Conpositae leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositis notis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen ac dolum ultro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proditionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 47</bibl>: pacem componere, v. B. 5. supra.—</sense><sense id="n9647.46" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum summā concordiā, quos dimitterent, quos retinerent, composuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 40, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.47" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ii, secretis conloquiis conponunt Gallos concire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.48" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut domi compositum cum Marcio erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 37, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositum inter ipsos ut Latiaris strueret dolum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">P. a. subst.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n9647.49" n="3" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to feign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>, in order to deceive or delude, etc.: composita dicta, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 260, 22</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 47 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne tu istic hodie malo tuo conpositis mendaciis Advenisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec bene mendaci risus conponitur ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 35</bibl></cit> (3, 7, 3): <cit><quote lang="la">sed vobis facile'st verba et conponere fraudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias in me conponis inanes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit> (3, 30), 19: <cit><quote lang="la">compositas insidias fatoque evitatas ementitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec fabulosa et composita videntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ut augendae famae composita, sic reliqua non in obscuro habentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustatem, ut cetera, in majus conponentem altores Jovis celebravisse,</quote> <trans><tr>exaggerating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 60</bibl></cit> Dietsch.—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">pretending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuming the appearance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">expression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Domitianus) paratus simulatione, in adrogantiam compositus audiit preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is in maestitiam compositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in securitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 44</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc compositus ad maestitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 20</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏsĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-postus</orth>), <itype>a</itype>, um. </sense><sense id="n9647.50" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Well-arranged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordered</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">constituted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (injuria) dum foris sunt, nil videtur mundius, Nec magis compositum quicquam nec magis elegans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: admiratus sum ... <foreign lang="greek">su/gxusin</foreign> litterularum, quae solent tuae compositissimae et clarissimae esse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acrior impetu atque animis quam compositior ullo ordine pugna fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 22, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegitur, etiamsi non adjecero, conpositum ordinatumque fore talem virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">composita et quieta et beata respublica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 36</bibl></cit>. —Of writings: <cit><quote lang="la">quare in his quoque libris erant eadem aliqua... omnia vero compositiora et elaborata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, pr. § 8; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illa quae curam fatentur et ficta atque composita videri etiam volunt,</quote> <trans><tr>elaborate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, pr. § 23.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the orator himself: <cit><quote lang="la">si aut compositi oratoris bene structam collocationem dissolvas permutatione verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:232" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 70, 232</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.51" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fitly disposed</hi> for any purpose, <hi rend="ital">prepared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adapted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">qualified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perficiam ut nemo umquam paratior, vigilantior, compositior ad judicium venisse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">equus bene naturā compositus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 46, 59</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, or with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arte quādam ab juventā in ostentationem (virtutum) compositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">alius historiae magis idoneus, alius compositus ad carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeque in adulationem compositus (sacerdos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Attici) non maxime ad risum compositi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturā atque arte compositus alliciendis etiam Muciani moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.52" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peaceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undisturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unimpassioned</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut peractis quae agenda fuerint salvo jam et composito die possis ibi manere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenis et nitidi et compositi generis amatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <trans><tr>mature</tr>, <tr>sedate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: adfectus mites atque compositi,<cb n="COMP" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilium (opp. erectum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetitio eorum (civium) labefactabat compositam civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:23:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 23, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.53" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Compound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made up</hi> of parts (opp. simplex): <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:38" default="NO">1, 6, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:5" default="NO">7, 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:3" default="NO">2, 12, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏsĭ-tum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is agreed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compact</hi>, etc.; only <case>abl.</case> in the phrases, </sense><sense id="n9647.54" n="(a)" level="5"> Ex composito, <hi rend="ital">according to agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in concert</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 12</bibl> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ex composito orta vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 25, 1</bibl>; 40, 48, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.55" n="(b)" level="5"> De composito, <hi rend="ital">by agreement</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 1, p. 273</bibl>; and, </sense><sense id="n9647.56" n="(g)" level="5"> More rarely in the same sense, composito alone, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 129</bibl>.—Hence also <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏsĭtē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">in an orderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regular</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">skilful manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">properly</hi> (class. but rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Quint.): ambulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">composite et apte dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:236" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 71, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">composite, ornate, copiose eloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">composite atque magnifice casum reipublicae miserati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene et composite disseruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 52</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositius cuncta quam festinantius agerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
